Here at Babcock International, Devonport we’re looking to recruit an IT Project Manager- Application / Infrastructure to join an established, projects focused team working at our Devonport site.

Are you ready to do your career’s best work with a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to pioneer a new type of experience at the intersection of physical play and technology?
Creative Play Lab (CPL), LEGO’s innovation department and origin of successful products like LEGO® Super Mario, is incubating a new (top secret) project. CPL’s mission is to create exciting new experiences which share our love of LEGO building with future generations of kids, whilst keeping play relevant for existing builders.

We are looking for a seasoned design leader to manage, challenge and inspire a highly innovative team. Equipped with extensive people leadership and interaction design experience – demonstrated through successful launches of cutting-edge products – you will re-define toys by creating magical and memorable moments that will wow kids for decades to come.

You will lead your agile team through this high-stakes, category defining project. No two days will ever be the same but here’s a snapshot of what you can expect.
Core Responsibilities
In partnership with the Toy Design Director, translate the product vision into a design direction, leading the Design teams across intuitive UX, toy and electronic interaction design.

Represent the voice of our audience – the child. You are a big kid with an understanding of the psychology of play and design for kids (experience creating play for kids, play loops, play mechanics, rewards systems and how play relates to human responses & vice versa).

Drive the user experience development process, deeply integrating design research with kids. Ensure that kids can intuitively understand the core system functions, set-up & use them seamlessly, then be surprised, delighted and inspired by the results.

Integrate Toy & Tech – champion play first but ensure the tech delivers. Represent the two on behalf of the kids, uphold our play and tech principles and use them in your decision making.

Protect the investment – help less technical members of the team understand the desirability, feasibility and viability impacts in technical trade-off discussions – ensuring solutions are fun.

Advocate to the Tech team to ensure the project delivers intuitive and productive design authoring tools, to enable design teams to work quickly and iteratively, delivering maximum play quality.

Evangelize to the LEGO Product Groups – partnering with internal stakeholders, understand the needs of the existing LEGO Product Lines and use this to inspire and guide interaction development. Convince the existing Product Lines of the play & UX value of the project.

Play your part in our team succeeding

We aim for the highest bar in innovation, and working with our internal and external partners we make sure that our innovations move smoothly into production.

The team are tackling strategically important projects designed to create new toy categories, and this complex project requires a substantial investment in technology and its success factor rests on the quality of the UX, interactions and play the technical innovation creates for kids. The Interaction Design Director takes the primary responsibility for ensuring that the system experience is easy, intuitive and playful.
Do you have what it takes?
Experience and track record are more relevant than specific education. We would love to meet applicants from diverse backgrounds.

Experience in explorative work and R&D – thrives with ambiguous, early development projects and brings organised focus to discovery phases of a project. Experienced with Agile and rapid iteration environments.
Several years of experience as a leader in a creative role – team leadership, goal-setting, people development.
Demonstrated experience in pushing boundaries beyond typical, existing play types – e.g. creating a never-before-seen type of play.
Demonstrated ability to make difficult trade-off decisions and explain reasoning to gain buy-in from the team.
An energizing and inspiring leadership style – champion your team, empower them and unlock their potential whilst pushing for the highest standards, always represent the voice of the kids in all decision making.
Pragmatic dreamer – you will be able to show projects where you created grand visions based in deep market understanding and grounded in the play needs of mainstream kids.
A challenger mindset – help evolve the broader business by role modelling new approaches and ways of working, do not accept the status quo.
Natural connector – adept at forging relationships with internal stakeholders, to evangelise the project and solicit input.
Technically literate & creatively minded – experienced with complex consumer electronics projects and software development, having lead interactive or interaction teams in a creative industry (toy, games).
Good command of project/development management tools is an advantage (e.g. Jira, Microsoft Project, Hansoft).
Experience of development tools, such as Unity and Git, is an advantage.
Advanced level of English.
The successful applicant will be asked to take part in a Child Safety Background Check.

Other Considerations
We offer a flexible approach to your primary office location, working either out of LEGO® ’s home town of Billund, Denmark, or London. There may be travel to each of the team studios from time to time, as needed by the project. As you will be leading a distributed team, the ability to lead remotely is essential.
Join the global LEGO® family
Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is proud to be an equal opportunity and an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, colour, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.

We support our employees in being there for the moments that matter in life and celebrate families of all kinds, the loved ones that make us who we are. Being part of the LEGO Group also means taking part in our annual Play Day, playing a part in building a sustainable future and continuing our mission to “inspire and develop the builders of tomorrow.” Build your career brick by brick at the LEGO Group.

You are the one responsible for ensuring we achieve successful results for our clients and you will work in conjunction with our excellent Campaign Managers to deliver industry-leading campaigns.
2. Client Relationship Management
Your role is to understand the goals of the client and help them set things up to best meet those objectives. We also like to build collaborative relationships with our clients that also make it enjoyable to be a part of.

About TRGT
Not your typical agency...
We set up TRGT because we felt a lot of agencies were overcharging and underdelivering where it really mattered; there was too much emphasis on making results look good rather than actually making them good. We focus all of our time on improving returns for our clients using a combination of industry-leading expertise, in-house tech and excellent collaboration. The results speak for themselves.
We offer a fast-paced, dynamic and inclusive environment where all employees can have an impact. Our people are our most important asset and you will be challenged to achieve, grow and develop. You will get a lot of autonomy within your work and are looking for proactive people that thrive in such environments. We encourage a healthy work-life balance and have a flexible approach to making work hours fit around personal obligations outside of the workplace.
We've been working remotely for 6 years; we know how to build teams, collaborate and deliver projects without being in the same room and all business structure and processes are designed with this in mind.

Job Title: Salesforce Delivery Director, Salesforce Consulting, Private Sector
Job Description:
A career in our Salesforce Consulting practice will provide you with the opportunity to help our clients leverage Salesforce technology to enhance their customer experiences, enable sustainable change, and drive results. We focus on understanding our client's challenges and developing custom solutions powered by Salesforce to transform their sales, service and marketing capabilities by exploring data and identifying trends, managing customer life cycles, strategically building and leveraging online communities, driving employee engagement and collaboration, and connecting directly with channel partners to share goals, objectives, and activities in a secure, branded location.

You'll help our clients improve the sales process cycle from lead generation through purchase by making it more targeted, personal and coordinated across channels and better manage customer acquisition and interactions.

Responsibilities
As a Director, you’ll work as part of a team of problem solvers with extensive consulting and industry experience, helping our clients solve their complex business issues from strategy to execution.

Specific responsibilities include but are not limited to:
Proactively lead the practice by setting strategy, drive the development of new business in the market, and provide technical advice across disciplines
Building strong networks within the firm to spot and capitalise on opportunities to get involved in projects that others are leading across a number of different business units and sectors
Identifying and discussing key issues with our clients to identify potential opportunities
Responsibility for a majority of day to day client communications
Responsibility to shape and deliver various projects that exceed the expectations of our clients and our own assignment quality criteria
Manage and deliver large projects by developing the project team, assessing engagement risks throughout, driving conclusions, and reviewing / challenging the output produced by the team
Responsibility for management of engagement financials

About C Space

C Space is a multi-awarded pioneering insight and innovation consultancy with offices in Boston, New York, San Francisco, London and Tokyo. Over the years we have helped clients like Google, Samsung, Jaguar Land Rover, L'Oréal, Orange and Allianz grow by developing new products, services and communication together with their customers. Most of our clients have worked with us for a number of years and about 80% keep coming back for more every year: building long-lasting relationships with our clients is the key ingredient to our success.

Insight at C Space isn't like insight at other agencies; it's faster, more entrepreneurial and more integrated. And it doesn't just focus on finding the 'truth' but more importantly on leveraging that truth with those who matter in our clients' organisation: we truly care about and organise ourselves around having impact on our clients' business – by either making them or saving them some money.

Our Promise is to deliver Customer Inspired Growth. How we do it:
Customer As A Service: Drive customer centricity through always-on online communities underpinned by best-in-class technologies that enables you to connect data sources and plug the customers at the heart for decision making
Data & Analytics: a technology first approach to quantitative research focused on helping our clients make strategic, customer-first decisions
Insight & Foresight: Anticipate changes and create strategies that outperform the competition.
Customer Experience: Segment the market, map the journey, identify biggest drivers of growth, create solutions that delight customers across all relevant touchpoints.
Innovation: Fast-track proposition development, generate buy-in across all relevant functions and develop products and services that always win.
Customer Centricity Programs: Bring stakeholders closer to customers so they make decisions with a true customer intuition
Why do clients keep working with us?
We get to Human Truths, not just a small piece of the data puzzle: We blend reported and factual, qual and quant, new and old data to unpack real truths that you can trust, that are new, and that are useful to your business.
We are business partners, not research suppliers: We pioneered co-creation in the 90's, and it's always been our DnA: we develop solutions with, not for, so they are business-relevant, trusted and organisationally adopted.
We get to impact, real business impact - not inefficient insight metrics: We develop KPI's from the outset, and we make them ladder up to actual business outcomes (from NPS to sales). We ask our clients to hold us accountable to them – so insight stays valuable.
We are Global, not a hipster London bubble: With Offices in 4 continents, 22 languages spoken in-house, and ~90+ markets covered in the past year, we get cultural nuances, and we make logistics and technology work to increase our reach.
We pride ourselves on our friendly but high-performing culture. We love people who are self-starters, see the glass as half-full and thrive in a fast paced, entrepreneurial environment: Half of C Space management in the EMEA business started their career at C Space as entry level consultants. We tend to attract people who are curious about the world and who have been able to match this curiosity with the ability to problem-solve challenges for clients in marketing and insight departments. Ultimately, there are five traits that all our people have in common:

Ambition Collaboration Appetite to learn Resourcefulness Humour

We are passionate about our people and proud of our culture. We have six 'behaviours' to ensure that we are delivering fantastic work, continuing to learn and develop and building a high-performance culture which creates opportunities for those who work here:
I've got this: taking responsibility, doing what we say we will.
Only accept awesome: delivering high quality work that we are proud of and has impact.
Show the love: celebrating successes & ensuring everyone has a voice.
Do what scares you: challenging ourselves, taking risks and learning more.
Tell it like it is: being honest and freeing ourselves from "office politics" and "hidden agendas"
Open up and listen: Listening first and fully before we respond or react

About Global Blood Therapeutics:
Global Blood Therapeutics (GBT) is a biopharmaceutical company dedicated to the discovery, development and delivery of life-changing treatments that provide hope to underserved patient communities. Founded in 2011, GBT is delivering on its goal to transform the treatment and care of sickle cell disease (SCD), a lifelong, devastating inherited blood disorder. The company has introduced Oxbryta® (voxelotor), the first FDA-approved treatment that directly inhibits sickle hemoglobin polymerization, an underlying cause of SCD. GBT is also advancing its pipeline program in SCD with inclacumab, a p-selectin inhibitor in development to address pain crises associated with the disease. In addition, GBT’s drug discovery teams are working on new targets to develop the next generation of treatments for SCD. We are currently expanding our geographic footprint to Europe. Job Title: Senior Regulatory Affairs Business Development Director, Oncology
Job Description:
Within Oncology Regulatory Affairs, we work in areas of unmet needs and take innovative regulatory approaches to bring life-changing treatments to those who need it working across our pipeline and the business to get medicines to patients as efficiently and effectively as possible. As an industry leading Oncology Regulatory function, were growing fast and were as focused and committed to the development of our people as we are our business providing an open and supportive space to explore, learn, grow and develop across all roles and levels.

The Senior Regulatory Affairs Business Development Director is accountable for leading the strategic regulatory activities for business development aspects related to the review and analysis of a potential product/group of oncology products of various levels of increasing complexity. In addition, this role will contribute to the decision-making process to go or not go into a development agreement or a partnership of similar nature with a third-party.

You will possess strategic leadership skills, have a deep understanding of global regulatory science and overall drug/biologic development processes and strategies for high profile, complex or novel development programs. Experience and knowledge of the Oncology disease area is critical to being able to influence cross-functional discussions within Business Development and relevant stakeholders.

The Senior Regulatory Affairs Business Development Director has the ability to take on the Lead role to analyse from a functional perspective, the opportunity, strengths and weaknesses for a product/group of products intended for acquisition or development partnership, or for the regulatory evaluation of any third party of interest to AstraZeneca within Business development Oncology. Youll have the ability to deliver the Oncology Regulatory Science and Strategy (ORSS) regulatory assessment as well as serve as the Regulatory Representative on the Business Development Team to present the ORSS assessment and recommendations to Senior Leadership. You will also act as a Business Development Team Member on behalf of ORSS for any on-site activity with a third-party, as well as the transfer of relevant regulatory information if an agreement takes place.

Typical Accountabilities:

Business Development Regulatory Analysis:
Accountable for the development of the regulatory review and evaluation of global nature for a product/ group of products of various levels of complexity, and for ensuring that the assessment brings all existing regulatory information into a concise analysis designed to deliver the core necessary information to make a business development decision.
Leads the assessment activities, communication and updates of the Regulatory Assessment Document for assigned products/projects deal. Ensure appropriate cross-functional consultation within the Business Development team.
Accountable for the delivery of all relevant regulatory reviews that include available quality, safety, efficacy data, level of interactions with authorities, geographical scope of the deal, the current probability of regulatory success together with risk mitigation measures that would be necessary if the deal was favourably considered by the company. Partner with Reg CMC lead to ensure an aligned regulatory assessment has been made,
Lead the objective assessment of emerging data against aspirations as the assessment progresses in the cross-functional team and update senior management on project risks/mitigation activities.
Leadership:
Serves as the single point of contact and ORSS subject matter expert representative on Business Development Teams.
Leads the planning and construction of the regulatory assessment and core review information.
Leads the Global Regulatory Technical review with taking into account input from key Business Development members from a regional perspective, emerging markets, RA CMC as well as delivery & enablement, as necessary within the scope of the foreseen deal. This includes the need to take into account regional regulatory requirements that will be integrated into an optimum Global Regulatory Assessment that in turn contributes to the Global Business Development Evaluation.
Ensure effective regulatory representation in potential partnership activities.
Ability to provide a regional focus in consultation with Regulatory Regional Directors and in addition to be the overall global lead in late stage complex projects. Accountable for interacting with the cross-functional team to ensure business needs are understood and to ensure the aspects of commercial engagement with the proposed regulatory strategies/risks/mitigation plans are clearly identified during the review.
Accountable for any follow-up activity.
Lead the oncology regulatory staff working on Business Development activities to ensure prioritized objectives that focus on the critical activities are successfully delivered to time and quality.
Partners with Global Regulatory Business Development Team to ensure technical, operational, and contractual deliverables are met seamlessly.
Support skill-development, coaching, and performance feedback of other oncology regulatory staff working within Regulatory Business Development.
Provide regulatory leadership as needed in product in-license/due diligence review, partnering, product divestment and product withdrawal.
Capability and credibility to lead key complex cross-department or cross-functional projects on behalf of ORSS and ability to cope with ambiguity and manage senior stakeholders, when necessary.
Proactively contributes to the across TA RAD community and/or across Oncology objectives and activities.
Regulatory Environment:
Monitor changes in the regulatory environment, both general and specific to the therapeutic area and support and advise Business Development Teams accordingly.
Has developed and actively uses external relationships with key stakeholders to reinforce AstraZenecas regulatory credibility.
Education, Qualifications, Skills and Experience required:
Advanced degree in a science related field and/or other appropriate knowledge/experience.
Must have previous experience in leading Major Health Authority interactions (e.g. FDA advisory committee meetings, Oral explanations, Scientific Advice, Pre-NDA/BLA, EOP2 meetings etc.).
Previous demonstrated experience of regulatory drug development including product approval/launch. Expert knowledge of regulatory affairs within oncology.
Broad background of experience working in pharmaceutical business and prior experience in several areas within regulatory affairs, e.g. Global, European, International, Marketing Company or experience at a health authority.
Experience in relevant therapy area (small molecules & biologics) is preferred.
Proven leadership and program management experience.
Ability to think strategically and critically evaluate risks to regulatory activities.
Ability to work strategically within a complex, business critical and high profile development program.
Successful contribution to a major regulatory approval at a global level.
A scientific and clinical understanding of the regulatory sciences.
Must demonstrate competencies of: strategic thinking, strategic influencing, innovation, initiative, leadership and excellent oral and written communication skills
Location: Cambridge, UK or Gaithersburg, US

The Regulatory Affairs Director (RAD) provides strategic and operational regulatory leadership to the development, commercialisation and life cycle management of assigned product(s). You will serve as the global regulatory lead (GRL) on early stage projects or specific indications of larger programs, or as regional regulatory lead. Youll contribute significantly to overall product and clinical strategy. The role plays a key role influencing regulatory authorities through regular contacts to improve regulatory outcomes. The RAD leads cross-functional teams in major regulatory submissions (NDA, IND/CTA), health authority interactions, label discussions, and securing NDA/BLA approvals. As a GRL, the RAD leads the Global Regulatory Strategy Team (GRST) in formulating Global Regulatory strategy and delivering on NDA Filings and Approvals. Alternatively, as a regional regulatory lead, the RAD is a member of the GRST and is accountable for providing the region-specific Regulatory strategy and advice. The RAD serves as the face of the company with health authorities.

Typical Accountabilities, what you will be doing:
Accountable for leading the development and implementation of the regional or global regulatory strategy for a product/group of products. Ensures that the strategy is designed to deliver rapid approval with competitive labeling in keeping with the properties of the product(s) and the needs identified by the business, markets and patients. This includes health authority engagement strategy and considerations of expedited regulatory programs.
Lead cross-functional Teams in major health authority interactions. This includes setting the strategy and planning for the interaction, driving the formulation of the briefing document focused on strategy and scientific content, leading the team through meetings rehearsals, and moderating the meeting itself.
Lead a Global Regulatory Strategy Team (GRST) of key contributing members from the regions, emerging markets, RA CMC, Labelling and members of the submission and execution team. Participate in coaching, and performance feedback to members of your GRST.
May (depending on role and project) represent Regulatory Affairs on Global Product Teams (GPTs) providing strategic Regulatory advice and be accountable for all Regulatory activities
Accountable for the delivery of all regulatory milestones on your team including assessment of the probability of regulatory success based on a thorough assessment of regulatory risks and mitigations. Lead preparation of the regulatory strategy document and target product labeling.
Demonstrate strategic leadership skills contributing to effective product development. Provide team leadership and participate in coaching, and performance feedback to members of the GRST.
Accountable for initiating and delivering key regulatory documents and plans and leading the negotiations with health authorities.
Lead the objective assessment of emerging data against aspirations and update senior management on project risks/mitigation activities.
Ensures appropriate planning and construction of the global dossier and core prescribing information led by the respective teams. Accountable for product maintenance, supply and compliance activities associated with marketed brands.
Partner with marketing companies (countries) and regional regulatory affairs staff to influence developing views/guidance.
Education, Qualifications, Skills and Experience:

Essential:
An advanced degree in a science related field and/or other appropriate knowledge/experience.
Previous demonstrated experience of regulatory drug development or equivalent, and experience with major Health Authority interactions. Prior experience with phase 3 design including end of phase 2 health authority interactions is desired. Contribution to a regulatory approval including leading response team and labelling negotiations would be a plus.
A solid knowledge of regulatory affairs within at least one therapeutic area in early and late development.
Demonstrated competencies of strategic thinking, strategic influencing, innovation, initiative, leadership and excellent oral and written communication skills.
The ability to think strategically and critically and evaluate risks to regulatory activities.
Desirable:
A good understanding of guiding principles in drug development such as benefit/risk profile, dose selection or statistical design.
Broad background of experience working in pharmaceutical business and prior experience in several areas within regulatory affairs. Experience in relevant therapy area (small molecules & biologics) is preferred.
Ability to work strategically within a complex, business critical and high-profile development program.
Critical thinking on current global regulatory science questions and good understanding of the corresponding scientific and clinical components

We’re currently looking for a Technology Director to join our team in London.
Idean is a global design studio, operating in the realms of design, technology and business. At about 90 here in London, we’re a curious and caring mix of thinkers, makers and doers. We believe that companies need to transform their business of today while building their business of tomorrow. We create products, services and Beta Businesses from scratch as well as transforming things that already exist from the ground up. Idean is a part of Capgemini Invent, and some of our projects are joint efforts with our extended family and some are Idean solo teams.
Idean is a place where you can make real change at a truly enormous scale. We work with some of the biggest and most-exciting businesses across all sorts of industries – so if you care about impact, this is a place where you can make it. We’re helping clients launch Beta Businesses and challenging existing setups in Telco, Energy, Financial Services and Retail, amongst other sectors. One of these new businesses, SMARTY, recently became the best-rated mobile network on Trustpilot. Not bad for a baby business. Our team has written a bunch of articles about their work and life here at Idean over on our blog.
We take on projects of many shapes and sizes. They can be short or long, depending on the scope. And they can sometimes involve some travel to see clients and users. However right now, like most companies around the world, we’re embracing remote working. Our studio has slowly started to re-open for those who'd like to spend time there (all optional of course) but our later plan is to develop a hybrid model, where some purposeful in-person working will sit alongside continued remote working. This means that to work at Idean UK your fixed place of residence must be in or around London (although we appreciate you might be elsewhere right now).
More about the role
As a Technology Director you will define the path that Idean takes in delivering software for our clients, now and in the future. You will lead our technology teams and collaborate with the other Idean disciplines to ensure we deliver ground-breaking digital experiences to our clients. The Technology Director will play a key part in the growth of the technology offering at Idean and therefore be comfortable owning relationships with our clients.
This is a multi-faceted lead role. You will be responsible for the technology that powers these products; if it’s technical, you own it. It breaks down like this:
Technical leadership - being clear on where the technology needs to go, how it will get there, and what the benefits will be.
New feature design - work with our product managers and designers to design, scope and prioritise new features.
Stakeholder management - own relationships with our C-Level clients, becoming a trusted advisor to technical and non-technical groups alike.
Delivering value to our clients as quickly as possible. In technology terms, this means we get stuff built and shipped and into customers hands as fast.
Development and deployment methodology - how do features get planned, built and deployed? Ensuring we start projects efficiently, but with an eye on the long-term lifecycle of an enterprise-grade product.
Championing Agile best practices, DevOps culture and Continuous Delivery.
Lead, coach and support engineers - work with them to do their best work helping them along the way.
Technical quality - owning the technical backlog and technical quality of the product.
We work with a lot of different technologies. We don’t have a set stack, although we lean towards contemporary open source frameworks and cloud services that let us get stuff done quickly. You’ll play a key role in helping ensure we’ve got an eye on what trends are coming next too.
You will
Be one of our technology leaders
Lead or support with new business efforts - ensuring Technology is an integral part of the solutions we’re designing for our clients.
Be comfortable with the technology patterns used by startups and enterprise corporates and know when to choose them as appropriate with our clients.
Bring a level of commercial awareness to the team, ensuring the full cost of ownership is understood; from project inception, through to delivery with repeated iteration and enhancement.
Lead multi-disciplinary teams, spanning design to product.
Lead our internal development teams, guiding and coaching across our Technology Community of Practice - building and enhancing the careers of our team.
Be an advocate for technology excellence across all our projects, aligning the importance of user-centered feature design with the essentials of high quality code and non-functional requirements.
Be entrepreneurial in spirit, making best use of all the tools available to you, across Idean and the wider Capgemini family.
Work well with people
Translate technical decisions into non-technical language for stakeholders outside of the development team or process.
Encourage a culture of learning, sharing resources and providing reinforcement of individuals goals within the development team.
Manage the onboarding of new developers and handover when a developer leaves the team.
Provide vision not dictation of the development of the software within the business.
Encourage a culture of learning, sharing resources and providing reinforcement of individuals goals within the development team.
Encourage sharing of knowledge
Ensure a high level of documentation standards within feature development.
Refine and continually improve processes around software reviews, reduce complexity conversations into tangible documentation.
Provide where necessary technical design documentation and reference.
Reduce silos of technical knowledge of critical systems.
Lead the effort to standardise the approach to implementing our technology-stack across our clients.
You have
Demonstrable experience delivering technical projects from conception to delivery to growth.
A comprehensive technical background and experience of a wide range of modern technologies, architecture and concepts. Your specific knowledge of a particular language isn’t as important as your grasp on the pros/cons and tradeoffs each one brings.
Experience working with and championing modern approaches to building innovative products, and effective technology teams - such as Agile, Lean and/or Continuous Delivery, and Infrastructure as Code.
A contemporary attitude and approach to building innovative products and services.
The ability to represent the technology perspective to our clients at management or board level.
The ability to set the technical direction and goals on a project, create a productive working environment, and support our developers to grow.
Experience of technology renewal, digital transformation projects, data science, machine learning, managing remote teams, or technology consulting would be nice to have.
Comfort reflecting on your individual performance and behaviours and, together with feedback from others, you will actively seek to continuously improve.
Buckets of positivity and a “can do” attitude.
Don’t worry about being a 100% fit. That’s impossible nonsense, anyway. If this sounds like an interesting opportunity to you, and you think it could work, let’s chat.
What to expect from our application process
Standard stuff, really. First, if we like what we see within your application, you’ll hear from us within a couple of weeks and you’ll be invited to have a chat by video-hangout or phone with a member of our Talent team. After this, there will be two interviews with members of this Community of Practice, perhaps with a task, depending on the role you’re applying for. There are no robots screening CVs here, so we apologise if it takes a little longer than expected.
We offer
A challenging, creative and supportive working environment is important to us. We’ve put a lot of thought into how we work, and how we grow and support our team. Our policies on inclusive behaviours, mental health and parental responsibilities, and more, are designed to work for our people. While we strive to be as inclusive and forward-thinking as humanly possible, we also know we can always do better. The point is, we’re keen to talk about and accommodate any need that helps you get good work done while enjoying a quality work-life balance.
Competitive salary
Company pension contribution of 6%
Group Income Protection
Life Assurance

25 days of holiday
A tiered parental leave policy, which offers 12 or 18-weeks maternity full pay and 4-weeks partner full pay (dependant on your tenure)
Access to our Cycle to Work scheme
Flexible working programmes. There is no one model to fit all so feel free to talk to us about what you need
Remote weekly community of practice get-togethers
Remote weekly company updates and lunch and share sessions
Remote quarterly company days. It's our time together to create plans and make sure everyone is involved in where we are going. It's also just a lot of fun.
Sounds good? Then apply!

We’re looking for a full time Chief Technical Officer to join our rapidly growing sports-tech startup, to take ownership over building a novel and exciting entertainment platform.

This is a unique opportunity to join an early-stage startup as part of the founding team that has already validated the concept and gained some traction. We are still a small team, but have raised two rounds of funding, launched our mobile app, and acquired several thousand users.

We operate a consumer-facing mobile app (built using Flutter and Firebase) and are also developing mobile and web SDKs, in order that we can license out the Tenner technology platform to other organisations.

This position will be paid a salary and will come with significant equity options to ensure you share in the success of the business.

About Us


Tenner is a startup based in London, building the next generation of second-screen entertainment.

We run free-to-play sports prediction games through our own iOS and Android mobile apps, and also build integrated solutions for sports organisations who use Tenner to engage and acquire their own fans. Our vision in the longer term is to build a powerful self-serve platform that organisations can use to set up customised fan engagement experiences within their own mobile and web apps.

The company was founded in January 2019 as part of the IMG Greenhouse program and has since closed two rounds of funding. Over the next year we're looking to scale both our own user base and our corporate partnerships, growing the team and our tech platform to cater to each.

Responsibilities
Mobile App: You will build out our existing mobile app, working on features such as leaderboards, live chat, and social functionality. You will also be responsible for ensuring the application is scalable, and enhancing our reporting capability and dashboards.
SDKs: You will be responsible for architecting generic and bespoke integrations we build for partners, allowing them to offer Tenner gameplay within their own mobile and web apps. You will also oversee the development of features built for these corporate clients, such as sponsorship promotion, merchandise sales, and custom game formats.
Platform Management: You will be responsible for DevOps, the testing and releasing of our software, and platform security.
Hiring & Management: As the company grows, you will need to hire and lead a technical team. You will identify roles we need to fill, and hire, train and manage all technical employees.
Other responsibilities: Your priority will be to oversee the tech side of the business, but you will be required to get involved in other areas, such as business strategy, product design, and fundraising.

Requirements

Have advanced mobile development skills and familiarity with Flutter/Dart and Firebase.

Be hands on, flexible and ready to contribute in whatever way they can to the success of the business
Be ambitious and tenacious, ready to drive the company through a high growth phase
Be excited and motivated by the company’s mission and product roadmap
We love applicants that:
Have an entrepreneurial streak and have started their own projects in the past
Have a personal interest in mobile games, sports, and live digital entertainment

Let’s talk about the job
Making quality second nature. This means doing what’s right even when no one’s looking. The work that you will do has a major impact on our clients and our firm. We pride ourselves on the high-level standards we have for the work that we do.

The minimum criteria

Skills to set you apart
Whilst not essential for the role, further insolvency qualifications such as CPI and/or JIEB.
Do you care about the same things we do?
We have six values we work by. When we meet, we’ll want you to show us how they’re important to you, too.
Collaboration: We work together, share ideas and always make time to help each other out.
Leadership: Everyone has the chance to lead their own projects.
Excellence: Quality is central to our purpose. We love what we do, and it shows. We sweat the details. We see things through, no matter how tricky.
Agility: The world moves quickly. To keep up, we stay flexible – changing approaches, changing projects, working offline, online, together and alone to get things done.
Respect: A given, of course: we value each other and our clients. We listen, we understand, we care.
Responsibility: The decisions we make and advice we give affects people’s lives and livelihoods. We take that seriously and always do well by doing what’s right.
Share ideas and profits
Unlike most firms, we’re also a shared enterprise. So when the firm does well, everyone does well by taking home a share of the profits. Of course, to get those profits, we need to share ideas and share responsibility for our work, too.
Bring your whole self
Now you’ve seen our values, it shouldn’t be a surprise that we’re creating a respectful, open, diverse place to work. Building an inclusive culture, where we value difference and respect our colleagues, is not just the right thing to do, it helps our people to perform at the best of their ability and realise their potential.
“We are committed to making sure that the opportunities within our firm are equally accessible for everyone – regardless of background or gender.” Dave Dunckley, CEO
There’s more to life than work
Families, children, sports, night classes…the things you do and the people you’re with outside work matter. They can inspire, motivate and energise you. Inside the office and out. So if you’d like to work flexibly, let us know. We’re happy to look at flexible working options for all our roles, and we’ll always do our best to keep your work and life in balance.

Company Description
Our mission at Ori Biotech is to enable patient access to a new generation of life saving cell and gene therapies. We have created a platform technology which automates cell and gene therapy manufacturing and has the potential to help make these treatments affordable and widely available to patients at scale.

Revolutionary scientific breakthroughs are currently being made in cell and gene therapy (CGT) to treat all types of disease ranging from cancer to rare genetic diseases. The first products using these technologies have come to market, and currently, there are more than 1500 clinical trials underway to bring even more products to the patients who need them.

The problem is that while these treatments are amazing, they are very expensive and can only be produced in very small volumes. This is where Ori Biotech comes in. Ori Biotech’s founding team is made up of cell and gene therapy/ life sciences veterans and has the backing of some of the top VCs in the US and UK. Having just closed its £23M Series A funding round in August 2020, the company is entering a rapid growth phase bringing on new team members to service its growing customer base. This is an excellent time to join our world class team and be an integral part of bringing the Ori platform to market.
Job Description

Key Responsibilites

Oversee external testing phase. You will own the clinical validation work, manage system performance review & lead next iteration of product development (MVP to finalised design)
Own the vision and development of the product. Develop, implement and execute Ori’s MVP platform development and long-term vision of a fully digital cell and gene manufacturing platform
Build a world-class team. Build, manage and mentor an in-house technical/engineering team who work alongside the scientific team to deliver solutions to Ori’s customers.
Accountable for compliance with regulations. You will bring apply your experience with developing medical equipment, and ensure that Ori is compliant with all regulations and requirements (e.g. IQ, OQ, PQ, CE, ISO standards etc.)
Experience in working with developing sterile products, familiar with sterilisation methods and standards
Act as a thought leader. Represent Ori to the CGT technical ecosystem to reinforce Ori’s thought leadership position in CGT manufacturing technology
Apply expertise and knowledge:
– Familiarity with EU Directive 2002/98/EC on human blood and blood products
– Understanding of FDA regulations around biological products (CFR 610)
– Understanding of FDA regulations on cell & tissue culture devices (CFR 864-C)
– Understanding of CFR 21 Part 11
– End to end patient manufacturing records (api expertise)
– Rapid in-trial process development (bioprocess modelling)
– Automate QA/QC (bio process modelling and QA/QC)
Apply if
You are passionate about Ori’s mission to enable patient access to a new generation of life saving cell and gene therapies
You want to build a business from the ground up, and thrive in fast-paced, agile and unstructured environments
You are self-motivated and have the ability to deliver on objectives

You are a fluent English speaker

Knowledge of technological trends to build strategy
Understanding of budgets and business-planning

The Role
The FCA has been driving significant organisational, people, process and technology change in order to continue its evolution towards becoming a regulator of the future. This involves the ability to use data more effectively to drive our regulatory decisions and build greater internal cohesion across a wide variety of financial services industry players, as well as a broad remit as set by our statutory objectives. Significant improvements in digital enablement, business intelligence, market data, knowledge and information management maturity are being pursued in order to allow the FCA to remain a world leader in financial services regulation and a data driven organisation.

Our ambitious technological change programme is designed to help it regulate the 60,000 financial services firms under its remit. The new Director of Technology will drive the delivery of this change programme, helping ensure its benefits are full realised.

The main opportunities of the role include:
Working at pace, and cross functionally, to build technology capabilities fit for the future.
Leading the digital strategy for the FCA, ensuring that all systems necessary to support our operations and objectives are in place.
As a thought leader and change agent, providing innovative technological solutions to regulatory challenges, keeping the FCA at the forefront of innovation.
Play a central role in the transformation of the Operations Division, ensuring it is a strategic partner for the rest of the organisation.
Harnessing leading edge technologies and world-class technology vendor capabilities to deliver multi-million pound programmes to enable the above.
Building on the foundation of the FCA’s cloud-based “unified digital operating platform” to provide digital enablers to underpin the FCA’s data, intelligence and transformation strategies, utilising industrial scale analytics to enable decision support and automation.

What does the role involve? What are the key responsibilities?
A unique opportunity to join an internationally respected financial services regulator at a critically important time in the organisation’s development, and that of the financial services sector, and to influence its transformation into a regulator fit for the future.
Exercising responsibility for the technology organisation, focusing on the provision of effective and efficient information technology to the FCA and to regulated firms.
Creating and communicating a vision, strategy, programme of work and operating model that differentiates the FCA and underpins the regulator’s needs, ambitions and objectives. Explaining technology programmes, plans, budgets and opportunities to the Executive Committee (ExCo), gaining the required buy-in, commitment and approval.
Developing strong relationships across the organisation, with a particular emphasis on the following key groups: ExCo, FCA Board & Sub-committees, and other FCA Senior Managers, Senior Advisors and Suppliers.
Working with ExCo members to understand current situation and challenges to proactively develop digital and technology solutions:
Integrating digital and technology into the business service teams to create deep cooperation and facilitate agile approaches.
Using the data that the FCA owns to provide insights and opportunities for ExCo members.
Working alongside FCA leadership on the development of technology programmes that support and enable all business lines, providing insight into the innovative use of existing and emerging technologies that can accelerate the growth of the business and the achievement of objectives.
Providing effective management of the technology strategy, investments and major projects p across all areas of the organisation, and delivering key strategic and transformative technology change programmes.
Owning and using the FCA operating and technology architectures to make the regulator more effective and efficient:
Identifying opportunities to promote “technology as a service” where it makes sense to do so.
Championing the development of internal and external digitally based systems and processes with a view to increasing employee empowerment, operational excellence, and user centricity.
Proposing innovative solutions or services as a source of value and competitive advantage, in particular in the areas of data collection and the development of sophisticated analytics.
Managing the delivery of digital and technology to the budgets agreed, working with the ExCo and the COO to ensure the options are understood and the right decisions made.
Agreeing annual financial plans – monitoring performance against these plans, identify key issues, put in place appropriate controls and measures as well as report performance and variances.
Ensuring the stability and security of operational systems and processes is maintained and that service is delivered to agreed and defined levels of service and within agreed budgets. Supporting the continuity of critical activities across all the FCA’s operating divisions:
Meeting the technology production standards that the FCA expects of a regulated firm.
Managing outsourced services to budget and service levels agreed.
Meeting the security standards set by the CISO.
Defining, implementing and maintaining robust best practice technology governance and control principles and policies, and ensuring these are adopted across the organisation:
Establishing and executing action plans to meet requirements for compliance with all internal policies and external regulations applicable to technology.
Attracting and selecting top talent and building a focused, business-oriented and highly qualified team.
Maintaining a strong awareness of technology trends, innovative uses of technology and emerging best practice for relevant devices, systems, processes and data. Ensuring that the strategy is flexed as appropriate to reflect such developments where needed, in a cost-effective manner.
Organisational leadership – You will work closely with the CEO and your peers to deliver the FCA’s Mission.

Associate Director – Risk & Insurance Due Diligence (London, UK)

An exciting opportunity has arisen for an Associate Director (AD) in Aon's rapidly growing M&A and Transactions Solutions ("AMATS") practice in the UK (London). Aon’s AMATS team provides both deal advisory services and a wide range of transaction solutions to clients undertaking M&A activity across EMEA. The current pan-European team has a diverse range of backgrounds including risk & insurance specialists, investment bankers, ‘Big 4’ accountancy firms, lawyers, actuaries, cyber security experts and human capital specialists.
The AMATS team is a combined practice of Insurance, Human Capital, Cyber and Intellectual Property experts with a dedicated focus on transactional activity. The team provides insurance advisory services to private equity and infrastructure funds as well as strategic, corporate buyers, on both buy-side and sell-side opportunities. We are seeking a candidate for a project management position. The candidate must have a wealth of experience in the insurance industry either as an underwriter of broker. Specific M&A transaction and/or project management experience is not a pre-requisite although helpful.
The primary responsibility of the AD will be to undertake M&A insurance due diligence engagements which provide project management and advisory services to Buyers and Sellers in the pre-acquisition and pre-sale environment. The project work will consist of insurance due diligence, planning for post-closing insurance programmes, new entity cost structures, and reviewing applicable transaction documentation. Additionally, the role will involve the proactive identification of any additional M&A insurance solutions and wider advisory services that Aon may also be able to provide to clients during the transaction and following the completion of a deal.
Key to the role will be the coordination of Aon resources, technical advice and solutions across various geographies and practices within Aon. Regular interface with the Client and their advisors is a key facet of the role.

Your impact

Undertake insurance due diligence advisory for private equity, infrastructure and corporate clients in support of their M&A processes; diligence includes a review of the target’s exposure and insurance-related information provided in the data room, interviews with management, collection and tracking of requested information, gleaning and collation of technical insurance commentary and production of diligence reports.
Drive project management engagement.
Enhance the consistency and quality of our client deliverables by coaching, managing and overseeing junior members of the team.
Liaise with clients and other advisors.
Coordinate internal Aon expertise/resources/solutions across various practices and geographies.
Increase the ratio of solutions delivered on each engagement through pro-active identification of deal issues where AMATS can deliver value adding solutions.
Management of post-close programme placement.
Build and foster client relationships.

Excellent communication, influencing and interpersonal skills across organisational levels.
Property & casualty insurance experience (broking or underwriting).
Ability to work independently, manage competing tasks through effective prioritisation and delegation.
Track record of delivering the highest quality client deliverables (written and verbal).

Internal and external networking experience and abilities.
Technical insurance and due diligence background.

Job Description:
Job Title: Analytics Director

Reporting To: MD AB EMEA

Department: Go To Market, EMEA

Location: King Office (London), Wardour St, Soho, UK

Your Platform

Activision Blizzard plays a centralized role in the creation of epic entertainment by supporting our interactive gaming brands and studios with a diverse range of career opportunities across corporate functions such as Marketing, Communications, Legal, Human Resources, Finance and Supply Chain.

Based in Soho, the cultural heart of Londons West End with a vast array of classic record shop and leading film companies, media offices and great restaurants. Regents Park is close enough for a lunchtime run, as are the delights of Piccadilly Circus and the shopping mecca of Oxford Street. It is conveniently walking distance from a number of London tube stations and mainline train stations.

To learn more, check us out at www.activisionblizzard.com or on Twitter at @ATVI_AB.

Your Mission

As Analytics Director, you embark on the path of building a world class consumer analytics practice - aiming at deepening our knowledge of players and consumers, and driving informed decision making for our go-to-market strategies.

You will ensure that marketing decisions and designs are made with the player firmly in mind. You will keep a pulse on both current and future players and more broadly entertainment consumers. You will look beyond internal analytics to understand behaviours and how to ignite passion and enthusiasm. We expect you to combine deep empathy and real understanding with strong analyticial skills.

Through your work, you will stretch the depth of understanding of our players and prospects. We will expect you to tirelessly champion a player-centric approach to marketing on the EMEA Leadership Team. Taking the role of a strategic planner, you will be part of creating the business initiative briefs that will be the guiding stars of our most important regional projects.

Your good business sense and strong analytical mindset will allow you to successfully partner with marketing and business teams to promote player-centric marketing heavily informed by internal and external data and player research. You will interact with our world class global Player Insights Team and Business Intelligence as well as our marketing and franchise leaders.

You will thus spread a strong data culture throughout the organization, as well as be a champion for understanding the different cultures and player mindsets in the EMEA region.

Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities:
Be the voice of the player on the EMEA Leadership team
Collaborate with the dedicated teams in Activision & Blizzard on all things data & insight.
Conduct business analyis which links internal data across AB, external data from 3rd parties, and primary research in order to represent the consumer in business and marketing strategies
Define and analyse consumer patterns, trends, and metrics to identify new opportunities for growth. This would include TAM (total addressable market) analysis by platform and territory across EMEA
Develop tools and work with stakeholders in our headquarters to look at the EMEA customer journey by territoiry and map back to Activision and Blizzard franchises across platforms
Provide strategic recommendations based on deep-dive analysis of consumer behaviour and perceptions and communicate findings to key partners (Marketing & Communications, Franchises, Territory and FP&A teams) to guide business/marketing strategy and fuel decision-making
Help articulate business cases with sound player research and key insights for pitching and forming key partnerships with third-parties in the region
Collaborate with HQ Player Insights to lead the research efforts in the region, required to outline key insights (e.g. key moments of truth, past campaign behaviour analysis) and identify specificities in marketing for EMEA consumers.
Player Profile

Minimum Requirements:
Degree level qualification - MS/PHD in Engineering, Computer Science, Math, Economics, Statistics, or Psychology / Behavioural Science.
+5 years of marketing data science, decision science, or marketing analytics experience.
A demonstrable skillset in statistics and probability.
Previous experience in a marketing environment, with marketing research or marketing analytics experience
Experience combining sentiment (survey) and behavioral data.
Outstanding written and verbal communication skills. Ability to explain complex analytics topics in plain language suitable for non-technical and non-analytical executives and cross-functional partners.
Passionate advocate for the customer with experience in consumer research and testing methodologies.
Ability to build business cases, driven by return on investment, for new marketing approaches
Demonstrated success in insight and strategy development with the ability to motivate and guide team to achieve results
Extra Points:
Someone who already understands gaming
Our World

Activision Blizzard, Inc. (NASDAQ: ATVI), is one of the world's largest and most successful interactive entertainment companies and is at the intersection of media, technology and entertainment. We are home to some of the most beloved entertainment franchises including Call of Duty®, World of Warcraft®, Overwatch®, Diablo®, Candy Crush and Bubble Witch. Our combined entertainment network delights hundreds of millions of monthly active users in 196 countries, making us the largest gaming network on the planet!

Our ability to build immersive and innovate worlds is only enhanced by diverse teams working in an inclusive environment. We aspire to have a culture where everyone can thrive in order to connect and engage the world through epic entertainment. We provide a suite of benefits that promote physical, emotional and financial well-being for Every World - weve got our employees covered!

The videogame industry and therefore our business is fast-paced and will continue to evolve. As such, the duties and responsibilities of this role may be changed as directed by the Company at any time to promote and support our business and relationships with industry partners.

Activision is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

Albus Health (registered as ‘BreatheOx Limited’) is a medical technology spinout company from the University of Oxford that develops intelligent remote monitoring systems. Within three years of forming, we have won several innovation awards, raised nearly £3 million in funding and commercialised our first product through a contract to supply to one of the world’s largest pharma companies in the respiratory space.

We are now looking for a CTO who can help make our vision of improving the lives of hundreds of millions of people around the world a reality.

What do we do and why do we do it?

Chronic respiratory conditions such as asthma and COPD are common, affecting a billion people worldwide, and are some of the leading causes of death and disability. Several billion dollars are spent each year into research and clinical trials in these conditions. However, the best tools available to monitor symptoms at home are subjective or require active engagement from the users, leading to very poor adherence and data quality. Lack of reliable tools leads to slower, costlier, and inefficient research, as well as hundreds of millions of hospital admissions which could be prevented through efficient symptom monitoring at home.

Albus Home RD, our first product, is an award-winning device that remotely monitors symptoms without anyone having to do or wear anything. With our proprietary algorithms, this enables the collection of continuous and objective data when people are at home without requiring any input or action. Being passive and plug-and-play, it is suitable for people of all ages, regardless of their technical ability or location. Moreover, it does not need any contact between two people or between the user and the device, making it ideal for the post-Covid world! Our product has exciting applications in clinical trials, and through the use of predictive analytics, in the prevention of respiratory emergencies such as asthma attacks.

Who are we?

Our team comprises industry-leading clinical, technical, and commercial experts, including the head of Respiratory Medicine at the University of Oxford, globally renowned respiratory researchers, the head of Computational Intelligence and Biomonitoring Lab at Oxford, and the former CEO of a medical technology unicorn. Our co-founders have a combined background in computer science, finance, and clinical practice. Please visit our website www.albushealth.com for more details.

What have we done so far?

We spun out of Oxford in 2017 and have since won 3 innovation awards (InnovateUK) funded by the UK government as well as the AI in Health and Care Award announced by the Secretary of State for Health and Care at the London Tech Week 2020. We commercialised our first product in 2019 to help pharmaceutical companies collect objective data in their clinical trials and secured a contract to supply our technology to a clinical study by one of the world’s largest pharma companies in the respiratory space.

What’s in it for you?

We are at an exciting stage of the company - moving from early adoption to a rapid growth phase, scaling our first product and building the next one. We are looking for a full-time CTO to join us in our offices in central Oxford (post-February 2021, until when we will be working from home). You will be at the forefront of product development and growth, working across a range of aspects from ideation and development to deployment and scaling. Working in a young medtech start-up means that you will work directly with an exciting team of engineers, computer scientists, doctors and researchers who are passionate about solving one of the most enormous unmet needs in healthcare.

What will you be doing as the Chief Technology Officer?

You will be responsible for taking vital technical decisions in the company, executing them and playing an integral role in setting the company’s strategic direction, innovation and future growth. This involves working with the rest of the management team, managing the technical budget, joining conversations with external stakeholders, and liaising with the R&D, product, clinical and regulatory teams within the company. On the engineering side, you will be leading the development of hardware and software stack for existing product and architecture for new products. You will be responsible for deploying products to our clients and partners across Europe and the US. You will lead the existing team, hire new members and take a hands-on role in helping scope, architect, develop and deploy projects. Externally, you will be required to manage subcontractors, work with partners on collaboration projects and join conversations with investors.

You will be a key part of the management team that brings our vision of being the world’s best home monitoring company to life.

Requirements

Essential
6+ years of industry experience in managing and growing hardware and software development teams (at least 2 years in each)
2+ years of experience managing a tech team in a startup
Experience in productisation from ideation to scaling (full cycle for at least 1 product) for medical technology or health-tech products that have significant IP, data and regulatory components
Experience of managing teams using agile development methodologies
Experience liaising with external stakeholders (investors, clients, partners, subcontractors)
Desirable Criteria:
Founding member or one of the first 10 hires in a tech startup
Productisation experience for products with a significant machine learning, signal processing and electrical engineering components
Experience developing remote symptom monitoring products
Experience taking products through CE marking as a medical device (preferably class IIa, IIb or III)
2+ years experience developing products based on health tech security and interoperability standards
Benefits

You will be compensated with a combination of a competitive salary and equity in the company.

Description

About Us

At Masabi, we are helping to make cities better places to live, work and visit, by enabling seamless, frictionless journeys on public transport systems. We are a technology company, developing a SaaS-based fare collection and ticketing platform that allows commuters to buy and present tickets for public transport on their mobile phones or simply by tapping a bank card to travel. With deployments to over 80 transit agencies across 4 continents, Masabi’s team has been delivering innovation to millions of riders of public transportation for over ten years.

Proving ourselves as true innovators and category leaders, we launched a ticketing SDK - a first for public transit - allowing urban mobility providers like ride-hailing (Uber), journey planners (Transit), and bike and ride-sharing services, to integrate our market-leading ticketing platform into their applications, connecting services together for a seamless user experience. Current customers of Masabi’s SDK include Uber, Transit (NA), Jorudan (Japan) and Kisio/Keolis (France).

Come join us on this exciting ride as we build the transit technology ecosystem of tomorrow.

Role Overview:

In this role you will autonomously manage between 15 and 25 multi-layered headcount organised into a combination of Agile teams and direct reports in conjunction with multi-year roadmaps with appropriate budget ownership.

You will be ultimately responsible for building and developing your team structure(s) and for the delivery and operational excellence of product and service areas associated with validation hardware and software lifecycles supporting agency transit operations, fleet managers, and conductors as well as validator related supply chain partner stakeholders.

You will partner with senior product and service stakeholders in analysing business metrics and functional requirements, and translate them into robust and scalable technical solutions.

You are a leader of leaders, including senior technical managers, principal engineers, technical engineers, technical programme managers, and their teams while partnering with project managers, product managers, designers, and other internal and external stakeholders to manage the delivery of complex applications, tools, systems and services.

You will have ownership for business-critical systems and contributing multi-year components to our overall roadmap.

In this role:
You are responsible for making sure your software and hardware is running properly, your customers are taken care of, your team measures and publishes core performance metrics, and also identifies and resolves defects and incidents in a timely manner.
You build multi-layer lean organisations that contain high-performance teams of Agile, cross-functional teams who deliver predictably excellent results through rapid iterations that pivot in line with evolving business needs.
You have demonstrated competency in multi-team programme delivery achieving both short-term objectives and big picture plans across fiscal years with roadmap and business case submissions that affect many groups including those which are out of your direct ownership.
You have a strong understanding of customer, business, financial, and legal requirements that ensure your products and services are successful including healthy relationships with senior management and experts across Product, Services, Business Development, HR, Legal, and Finance.
You focus on growing organisational capability – this means placing an emphasis on all aspects of the employee lifecycle (recruiting, onboarding, performance management and employee development).
You are solution-oriented and continue to move forward in the face of ambiguity and imperfect knowledge. You are willing to innovate with bold, data-driven bets and do not suffer from “analysis paralysis”. You operate strategically, appropriately diving deep into issues when necessary, but you trust your autonomous teams to innovate and deliver results while verifying they are achieving the intended outcomes.
To be successful in the role you should have:
Previous hands-on experience as an engineer who has progressed within the ranks into a senior engineering team management role and is currently looking after multiple teams
Strong competency in a broad range of technology and computer science concepts, and know-how, when, and when not to use them. You can dive deep into a wide range of technical problems offering suggestions and feedback to your team. Your interest in technology and computer science has not faded as you moved into a leadership role and you are still comfortable with technical details.
Strong experience leading end-to-end software and hardware product delivery processes where the engineering ownership spectrum includes writing backlog user stories based on high-level product requirements, developing the product, developing automated testing for the product, deploying the product, measuring the success of the product, and being on call for resolving issues with the product.
Demonstrable experience successfully leading teams of engineers through multiple product development life-cycles for B2B and B2B2C business models including accountability for PCI compliance.
Excellent analytical skills with clear written and oral communication capability that is successful presenting to senior management levels outside of Engineering and into the ecosystem around Masabi.
Ability to travel up to approx once per quarter for single or multi-day visits to current and possibly new sites, which could include customer visits, in a post COVID scenario.
It would also be great to have:
A track record of introducing new, multi-organisational processes that improve supply chain efficiency, total cost of ownership, and/or time to market.
A track record of successfully mentoring and promoting senior managers, managers, principal engineers, hardware engineers, and technical programme managers to market validated standards.
Autonomous success communicating with markets, other supply chain partners, and senior management to collect and deliver on business, product, and engineering goals.

Job Title: Group Director of IT and Digital Transformation
Job Description:
London South Bank University (LSBU) is a dynamic and enterprising university which is looking to the future with ambition and purpose. Proud of its pioneering mission and heritage, it is strongly connected to the communities it serves. As winner of the Times Higher Education Entrepreneurial University of the Year Award and the Sunday Times award of University of the Year for Graduate Employment two years in succession, LSBU is now one of London’s leading modern universities.

Under the leadership of Professor David Phoenix, LSBU is an organisation that is fast becoming a university of choice for the new generation of students as it continues to develop new, creative and entrepreneurial approaches to teaching and learning. It continues to grow its established and internationally regarded applied research which underpins its 1000 employer relationships and feeds its curriculum.

LSBU has an exciting agenda to transform the student experience across the entire journey, putting students at the heart of its strategy. LSBU is committed to transforming the design and delivery of the student offer; leveraging digital technologies and agile ways of working to ensure the LSBU Group is fit for the future and can meet the evolving needs and expectations of students, staff and partners.

The Group Director of IT & Digital Transformation will lead both strategy and resources to create an environment in which digital, IT and information effectively supports education, research, enterprise and professional service activities within the University, and across the LSBU Group. The Director will serve as the lead institutional expert on IT and digital, consulting with senior-level stakeholders across the Group to identify business and technology needs and to optimise the use of information technology.

The successful candidate will have a strong track record of operating in complex, multi-sited organisations, leading and delivering excellence and improvement across the breadth of the portfolio. They will have the credibility, leadership and influencing skills to shape and deliver institutional IT performance; as well as a strong personal commitment to the values and mission of LSBU and the diverse communities it serves.

Job Title: Media Activation Associate Director - Paid Search

Ability to implement and adhere to and meet deadlines and project manage multiple campaigns
Excellent client relationship and management skills
Proven problem-solving skills and ability to think outside of the box for creative solutions

Detail oriented and responsive, deadline-driven with strong quantitative reasoning skills

Created by a team of proven FinTech entrepreneurs in 2016, Vitesse PSP is an FCA regulated payments business that provides global payment services to a range of businesses. Vitesse operates one of the largest domestic banking and payment networks in the world, giving its customers direct access to more than 100 countries’ domestic payment networks, covering over 60 currencies. Through a single integration, merchants gain access to in-country payment routing, resulting in significantly lower payment costs but with a much faster (increasingly instant) and data rich delivery. To date, the company has processed over £2.1bn across almost 2.3 million transactions.

Vitesse serves customers (including Brit Insurance, Axa, DXC Technology, Gett and Visa) in four key markets:
Insurance - greater visibility and control of loss funds and improved claims settlement.
Payroll - a simplified payment process for a global workforce.
FinTech - supporting businesses expand their global reach.
Corporate/Ecommerce - greater transparency, more cost effective and faster global payments.
Of these segments Insurance is the largest in revenue terms and also the fastest growing largely as a result of success in the Lloyds of London market, where Vitesse has established itself as the market leader. Vitesse is contracted with over 60% of the Lloyds market and provides liquidity management as well as supporting claims payments.

Vitesse has raised over £15m to date and recently closed a Series A round that was led by Octopus Ventures, one of the largest VCs in Europe. Vitesse grew to £3M+ of revenue in 2019/20 and the business plan is to continue doubling revenue in each of the next three to four years.
