You’ll be a strong internal figurehead and mentor working across many teams, helping to develop and inspire the next generation of Ipsos MORI ‘fame makers’.


What do I need to bring with me?
You are likely to have been in a marketing-related role for a large part of your career to date and may have worked at a marketing agency, a consultancy, at an advertising or media agency, or client-side.
You will have a point of view on how to grow a brand’s public presence in the B2B space.
You will be able to demonstrate your ability to inspire, encourage and coach others in having a louder voice on behalf of Ipsos MORI.
We are looking for someone to spearhead our initiative to have a stronger presence in brand and marketing circles. In the UK we are known as being a trusted and respected global research agency, but our image is more widely associated with opinion polling and social/government research, and our work in the brand and private sector is less well known. The person in this role will be an inspirational leader who will galvanise our teams, and coordinate our efforts to be more famous.

You are:
Not necessarily from an insights background, however you will be research-literate. Being comfortable looking at data sources – quant, qual, social media and others – and finding the ‘so what’ that our clients will be interested in.
Alert and interested in the evolution and development of trends in the world, and how they relate to consumer marketing
Up to date on marketing theory and the current debates and theories.
Experienced in creating original content and are comfortable speaking out and have an engaging public presence.
Collaborative & curious about the possibilities for driving growth.
Comfortable & competent working in partnership with a senior audience of Marketing & Insights clients – you demonstrate gravitas, credibility and leadership.
Someone who gets a buzz from collaborating across multiple teams to harness the best of Ipsos. You’ll also bring with you a network of influential contacts in the marketing world outside the insights teams, and have ideas on how to develop your – and our – network further.
Someone people want to work with. You’re a leader, but are able to get hands-on as and when needed – able to think on your feet and flex & pivot as needed, bringing people along with you.
Comfortable working in a very fast-paced, high intensity environment. You move fast and keep up.

About us…
We are one of the world’s largest research companies and currently the only one primarily managed by researchers. With offices in 90 markets, Ipsos brings together research, implementation, methodological, and subject-matter experts from around the world, combining thematic and technical experts globally with local knowledge to deliver top-quality research.

Our culture is unique - we have the entrepreneurial spirit and quirkiness of a small boutique, but we also have the resources, scale and diversity of a large global agency. We have more bright, friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic people, from more backgrounds, with more interests, skills and experiences to learn from. Our values are based on our diverse cultural backgrounds, helping us to be responsive, client-focused and flexible.

We are committed to equality, treating people fairly, promoting a positive and inclusive working environment and ensuring we have diversity of people and views. We recognise that this is important for our business success - a more diverse workforce will enable us to better reflect and understand the world we research and ultimately deliver better research and insight to our clients. We understand the importance of choice and offer a blended work environment, office and work from home. We also realise you may have commitments outside of work and will consider all flexible working applications - please highlight what you are looking for when you make your application.

If this is what you are looking for from your next role, we look forward to hearing from you!

This role presents the opportunity for an individual to join our fast-paced sales team and help develop our commercial digital opportunities - working closely with local and global stakeholders across the company to deliver new offerings and solutions to the British Vogue publishing team and help implement them. This is a pivotal role within our team, and will be essential to the success of British Vogue in this exciting period of growth and evolution.

This is a fantastic opportunity to work in a fast-paced team, on Condé Nast’s flagship brand.

Developing and establishing new digital opportunities for the British Vogue brand, and acting as a central liaison/manager for the sales team when assisting with their implementation.

Essential Skills & Requirements
An integral understanding of and experience in advertising sales - with a particular focus on digital (web, social and video), but also including print media
A passion for Vogue and an interest in the wider luxury market, with a particular focus on digital products and the offering of competitors

Job Title: Financial Services - IT Senior Manager - Delivering Deal Value
Job Description:
About the team
Delivering Deal Value (DDV) is a market leading team that assists Corporate and Private Equity (PE) clients in a wide range of high impact business situations. The majority of our work is in the Mergers and Acquisitions (M&A) space, with a focus on the operations and IT challenges both pre and post deal. We help clients achieve maximum value on their deal transactions by solving transformational and complex challenges. The M&A Deals we work on range in size from £50m to over £5bn and our clients include the most well-known brands and businesses in the world.
The Financial Services sector team within DDV provides M&A advice and support to insurers, banks, asset managers, payments providers, fintech firms, hedge funds and other financial services players. We are looking for excellent candidates to join the current team of 25 dynamic and friendly people who have a wide range of backgrounds and disciplines.
We recruit proactively from industry, consulting, private equity and audit to create a great blend of experience on each project. This blend of backgrounds helps us learn from each other and stay at the top of the market delivering fantastic results for our clients on landmark deals.
About the role
You will identify, plan, shape and support the creation of lasting value for our financial services and private equity clients as they undergo mergers, acquisitions and disposals. We work across the deal life cycle, from identifying value creation opportunities and conducting due diligence, to executing carve out and integration programs, realising synergies and creating value for our clients.
A career in the DDV team is a unique and rewarding challenge. The work is at the front of our client’s strategic agenda, often complex and done under tight deadlines. As a result, there are extraordinary opportunities for personal growth, learning new skills and career development.
Whilst the team is London based, deal activity is global, therefore projects can involve travel at short notice.
Your responsibilities
As a Senior Manager, you will be expected to take ownership of multiple projects and business development work at one time, and lead a team of problem solvers with extensive consulting and industry experience, helping our clients solve their complex business issues from strategy to execution. Specific responsibilities include but are not limited to:
Proactively assist in the management of a portfolio of clients
Develop strategies to solve complex technical challenges
Manage and deliver large projects by developing the project team, assessing engagement risks throughout, driving conclusions, and reviewing / challenging the output produced by the team
Shape and deliver projects to meet and exceed the expectations of our clients and our own quality criteria
Train, coach, and supervise junior staff
Be responsible for the financial management of clients
Lead business development activities to help identify and research opportunities on new/existing clients
Contribute to the development of your own and the team's technical skills
Develop strong internal and external networks
Keep up to date with industry news and developments

There are plenty of opportunities to build your personal and professional networks. Consulting is a relationship industry after all. We have weekly team newsletters, monthly team meetings and monthly socials, together with an annual away day. The team is a collaborative and supportive environment with lots of chances to socialise across our team and the wider business.
Who we are looking for
Professional experience: We expect successful applicants to have:
Experience of working in a consulting role in financial services, or a transformation role in industry, ideally banking or insurance
Experienced in M&A, synergy, integration and/or carve-out, and/or on change projects, restructuring or business improvement
Demonstrated ability to quickly assess the performance of a business (or elements of it) and outline improvement opportunities based upon limited information and/or interactions with senior management
Ability to quickly understand large amounts of information and draw out hypotheses and key messages
Extensive experience around IT and operational analysis to understand business processes, their associated costs and potential issues as well as opportunities for improvement
The ability to understand the impact of IT on commercial, financial and operational aspects of a business, ideally in the context of a transaction
Awareness of common IT application systems and infrastructure in one or more financial services sub-sectors
Knowledge of the key issues and challenges currently facing the financial services sector

Despite the above guidelines, we are keen to hear from candidates who don’t necessarily meet all the criteria but are a fantastic match for the personality characteristics below.
Personality characteristics
We work hard together, so we hire people who treat their colleagues well, who are not hierarchical and enjoy creating a happy culture even when under pressure
Extremely comfortable around C-suite or senior stakeholders, as most of our work is done at this level; you don’t need to be an extrovert, but confidence definitely helps
Comfortable with uncertainty and ambiguity in a project environment, and excited by the idea that you may not know what country you will be in next week
Extremely handy with Excel and PowerPoint. Much of our work involves detailed analysis and report writing, so it is critical you can work with these tools
Naturally curious; we love people who can apply logic and problem solving to difficult business problems

Nice to have:
MBA or other business management qualification
Other post-graduate or accounting qualifications are welcome

Our recruitment process:
We try to keep our recruitment process as lean and efficient as possible. For 90% of our applicants we have a simple 5 step process consisting of:
CV application
Online tests
In-person case study and interview with members of the team
Partner interview
Offer

If you fit the requirements for this role and find the opportunity as exciting as we do, please get in touch and submit an application as our open positions fill quickly.

Purpose
The incumbent is responsible for the regional technology oversight of Scotiabank offices within Europe & Asia-Pacific (APAC), including being the main point of contact for IT regionally, including representing IT to all regional regulators.
This includes building and managing local technology teams to service the needs of Scotiabank’s European & APAC Business lines. The incumbent is also required to manage IT as a business, driving cost-effective and efficient solutions and services.
Additionally, as data enables many aspects of our business, this role may also perform the role as the regional Data Custodian:The Data Custodian is the technology owner of the data for their domain and is a lead member of their domain working group, overseeing the technology-focused roles supporting the domain.
In the UK, the CIO role falls into scope under the Certification Regime and requires the individual to be internally ‘Certified’ as a significant harm function.

Leads and drives a customer focused culture throughout their team to deepen client relationships and leverage broader Bank relationships, systems and knowledge.

Understand how the Bank’s risk appetite and risk culture should be considered in day-to-day activities and decisions.

Builds a high performance environment and implements a people strategy that attracts, retains, develops and motivates their team by fostering an inclusive work environment; communicating vision/values/business strategy and managing succession and development planning for the team.

& APAC.Thisincludesday-to-dayoperation, application support (in conjunction with business line IT staff), personnel moves, IT Services such as desktop & data centre(s) support, BCP readiness and execution, regulatory compliance, and managementreporting.

Lead a Risk Management Culture

Direct the regional 1B function, as applicable regions, to ensure the 1st line of defense is focused on the effectiveness of all IT key controls and leverage a risk-based approach to prioritize improvements.

Run IT as a business, focused on performance metrics, KPI’s and KRI’s.Operate within a controlled budget, while maximizing the value of every dollar spent.

preferred.

Why we're hiring:
WPP IT is the team that helps WPP's colleagues and clients leverage technology and insight to improve performance and create sustainable competitive advantages. Our goal is to modernise ways of working, shift to cloud and micro-service-based architectures, drive automation, digitise colleague and client experiences and deliver insight from WPP's petabytes of data. In this pivotal role, reporting directly to the WPP Global CIO, you will define the IT strategy, enterprise architecture blueprints/standards and business capability-led roadmaps for all of WPP IT.

Our mission is to enable everyone to collaborate, create and thrive. Our people enable us to outshine our competitors – there are no limits to what you can achieve here.

Job Title: Director of Applied Science (Machine Learning and Computer Vision)
Job Description:
Onfido is the new identity standard for the internet. That means we only need an image of your ID and a selfie to prove that you’re you. In doing so, we help millions of people connect to the services they need and love more easily, speedily and safely than ever before, whether it’s renting a car or opening a bank account. Our vision is to create an open world where identity is the key to access.

We've received over $200 million in funding from world-class tech investors including TPG Growth, Microsoft, Salesforce to back our vision. And we're just getting started.

At Onfido, our AI scientists build the world’s most secure digital onboarding system used by thousands of businesses globally as the next generation of digital identity. We are looking for an exciting and dynamic leader who can lead our amazing team of AI scientists to push the envelope on several unsolved problems like uncertainty modelling, interpretable AI, protection against adversarial and Deep Fake attacks, differential privacy, bias mitigation, and generalised concept drift detectors within human-in-the-loop systems in service to our identity verification and digital identity products.

As a senior AI leader, you will support Onfido’s hyper-growth and passionately deliver real world value using state-of-the-art machine learning and computer vision techniques. We build fraud detection systems that operate at unprecedented performance levels with error rates of less than 1 in a million (99.9999% performance levels) while protecting against unknown unknowns? We detect thousands of fraud attacks daily in over a dozen industry verticals from banking to gaming to the crypto-world to shared economies and others. As businesses and services go online or maintain a purely online presence, secure, fast and reliable digital on-boarding is a necessary and enabling need.

At Onfido, we believe that identity is the key to access and therefore we are building the world’s most sophisticated identity verification system.
What you will be doing:
Be responsible for identifying customer needs and building products and services to meet those needs.
Build and develop the Applied Science team
Oversee and define the strategies, priorities and allocate resources to execute for delivery
Demonstrate ability to drive complex initiatives and deliver results in collaboration with engineering and product teams
Liaise and communicate high-level concepts effectively to internal and external stakeholders
Have strong executive presentation skills as well as strong written, communication and interpersonal skills
Have a track record of engaging with the academic community on CV and ML problems
Execute on submitting papers to top international conferences, grant writing and patent filing
Essential Skills and Requirements:
PhD or MSc degree in Machine Learning, Computer Vision or a related quantitative field.
Have an in-depth understanding of the technical and scientific issues
Extensive professional experience in building real world machine learning and computer vision applications.
Track record of successfully delivering high performance ML-driven products.
Have previously lead a team of machine learning specialists, working collaboratively with engineering and product management.
Successfully mentored people and teams to achieve their full potential.
Worked with customers to impactfully solve their problems.
Deep understanding of machine learning theory.
Good coding skills in Python (C++ is considered a plus) and hands on experience using at least one of the deep learning frameworks Tensorflow or PyTorch.

Desirable Skills and Requirements:
Technical experience in uncertainty modelling, explainable machine learning techniques, out-of-distribution detection, life-long learning, system design, interpretable AI and related fields.
Technical experience with conventional (non-DL) computer vision, signal processing and image processing techniques.
Working knowledge of cloud computing (preferably AWS) and tools and technologies such as Kubernetes, Docker, Git, etc.

We're committed to making Onfido a fantastic place to work, so we go to great lengths to give you what you need to succeed. You’ll receive:

- Share options in Onfido, through our equity schemes. Share options have a one year cliff and start vesting after probation over a four year period*

Who We Are


Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.

To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures—and business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.

Digital BCG


BCG has a long history of driving growth by embracing innovation and new ways of thinking. Through DigitalBCG, we bring together a diverse mix of consultants and digital specialists to ensure that we are supporting our clients throughout their digital transformation journeys. We work with our clients to fully understand the impact of digital on their business and set priorities that will transform their vision into value. Whether it be developing new technologies to support their core business, making better use of their data, or pursuing entirely new sources of revenue, our aim is to achieve radical improvements in productivity, flexibility, and speed. We are innovating how our clients are using artificial intelligence, robotic process automation, internet of things, personalization, blockchain technologies, and more to gain competitive advantage.

DigitalBCG encompasses a broad set of data, digital, and technology capabilities from BCG consulting teams and practices, along with our business units such as BCG Digital Ventures, BCG Platinion, and BCG GAMMA.

What You'll Do

BCG’s Data & Digital offering is closely aligned to our Technology Advantage practice were we work with our clients (often CIOs and CTOs), to position companies for the future. The rapid advance of technology has resulted in an explosion of data in business. The ability to decode this data can unlock a higher level of insight and drive a superior level of performance. That’s where we come in.

With experts in Big Data, Digital Business models, IT strategy, and IT efficiency/effectiveness, we leverage digital solutions to power transformations that stick. We believe transformations fail when companies focus too much on the finish line and not enough on the capabilities that must be built in order to get there and—most importantly—to stay there. Our teams work with client members from all levels of the organization in order to integrate our staff's strategy, operational, and industry experience with the client's individual situation, culture, and unique constraints.

Data and Digital Platform Experts help our clients improve performance through the use of data and technology. The extent to which a company has made the transition to a digital organization determines its ability to effectively field data, extrapolate useful information, and act on it in real-time. By combining digital and data analytics expertise with battle-tested transformation experience, you will empower companies to make that leap.

In this role, you will drive the vision for target technology platforms that deliver on client business objectives, and outline an achievable roadmap to implementation. You will set the high-level structure for the transformation effort, manage to tight timelines and client deliverables, provide hands-on training, and deliver the key enablers required to complete the project. Your team will include senior BCG leadership, teams of BCG Consultants, and both junior and senior client leaders working collaboratively to facilitate the transformation.

The Expert Consulting Track (ECT) is vital to BCG’s ability to successfully meet our clients’ demand for deep expertise and advanced technical capabilities. Experts deliver next-level impact for BCG's most complex and cutting-edge client challenges. Experts focus on developing BCG's thought leadership, commercial capabilities, and intellectual property assets; and their work is essential to our delivery model. Working as part of a multidisciplinary team to bring the ‘best of BCG’ to our clients, Experts come from diverse backgrounds, with expertise often gained outside of BCG in industry, academia, or specialized consulting.

As an Expert Associate Director, you will apply your deep expertise to generate value for our clients while building and contributing to BCG’s intellectual capital. Your role in projects can vary from team management to team advisor. You will leverage your expertise to add insight and drive clients toward recommendations and you will be viewed as a trusted advisor by senior clients. You will help scope and structure the work, onboard team members, and provide guidance throughout the project. Expert Principals contribute significantly to BCG’s intellectual capital, generate interest and excitement about their expertise area, and coach and mentor others.

What You'll Bring (Experience & Qualifications)

We’re looking for exceptional talent from consulting or industry to join us. You would typically have:
A minimum of 8 years of experience in leading and managing large, complex enterprise-level technology transformations, with expertise around specific issues that arise with modernizing technology and data architectures (data lakes, in-memory databases, containers, microservices, and how these relate to legacy architectures, common ERP architecture. Overall, a demonstrated ability to translate analytics and digital strategy into data, technology, and operating model implications
Experience delivering large-scale transformation projects and successful implementation including staffing and leadership development while taking a hands-on approach with clients
An outstanding academic track record
A proven project and people leader with exceptional drive and commitment striving for excellence
Willingness to travel internationally and to work remotely on client sites
Excellent communication and persuasion skills

Our Expert consultants within DigitalBCG are an integral part of BCG's core consulting team; you will work side-by-side with all practice areas to create value & competitive advantage for our clients. Your team will include senior BCG leadership, teams of BCG Consultants, and both junior and senior client leaders working collaboratively to drive the transformation, and shared services/control functions. You will roll up your sleeves with clients to work through both macro and day-to-day problem solving in an agile fashion and often times, you will also work side-by-side with agile coaches in an apprenticeship model to help our clients develop their internal agile coaching workforce.

About Plaistow South Big Local (PSBL)
South Plaistow is one of 150 areas across England to receive £1m of funding over 10 years from the Big Lottery to make an area an even better place to live. Plaistow South Big Local (PSBL) is the resident-led Big Local Partnership whose aim is to bring together the local talent, ambitions, skills and energy from individuals, groups and local organisations to achieve this and to make a massive and lasting positive difference to their communities.
We have a local Steering Group for PSBL who are the decision-making group responsible for the community plan and budget in Plaistow South, which is located in Newham in East London.
The four programme outcomes for Big Local are:
Communities will be better able to identify local needs and take action in response to them.
People will have increased skills and confidence, so that they continue to identify and respond to needs in the future.
The community will make a difference to the needs it prioritises.
People will feel that their area is an even better place to live.

Job Title: Digital Advertising Director, Vogue Publishing (1 year FTC)
Job Description:
Vogue: Digital Advertising Director, Vogue Publishing (1 year FTC)

Description

Vogue is looking for a highly-motivated, experienced and enthusiastic digital sales and strategy lead to join its dynamic commercial team.

This role presents the opportunity for an individual to join our fast-paced sales team and help develop our commercial digital opportunities - working closely with local and global stakeholders across the company to deliver new offerings and solutions to the British Vogue publishing team and help implement them. This is a pivotal role within our team, and will be essential to the success of British Vogue in this exciting period of growth and evolution.

The successful candidate will be a confident communicator and negotiator and should have experience in developing digital opportunities within the publishing or media environment. This role will also require significant experience in commercial sales - to include both display and bespoke content creation as the appointed individual will also have a dedicated client and media agency portfolio to manage. As such it is essential that they are proficient in selling across print, online and social channels so that they can hit the ground running.

In addition to their senior media sales experience, we expect applicants to have an excellent knowledge of the publishing landscape and a sound understanding of the Vogue brand. We are looking for a self-starter who is keen to embrace the many facets of this role - whether it be in building and developing relationships with existing commercial partners; approaching new business prospects to sell proactively; or working closely to develop our digital offering in order to ensure continued growth across display and partnerships.

This is a fantastic opportunity to work in a fast-paced team, on Condé Nast’s flagship brand.

Key Duties & Responsibilities

Developing and establishing new digital opportunities for the British Vogue brand, and acting as a central liaison/manager for the sales team when assisting with their implementation.
Collaborating with key digital stakeholders across the company to ensure we deliver the best possible suite of opportunities to commercial partners.
Generating new ideas on behalf of the British Vogue commercial team and working to ensure these are sold effectively.
Managing business relationships with a dedicated client category/media agencies at a senior level.
Seeking out and converting new business opportunities with a view to increasing revenue
Selling display advertising and partnerships across print, online, social and events – with extensive experience of each

Essential Skills & Requirements

An integral understanding of and experience in advertising sales - with a particular focus on digital (web, social and video), but also including print media
A passion for Vogue and an interest in the wider luxury market, with a particular focus on digital products and the offering of competitors
A desire to deliver ‘growth’ and support the wider team in achieving this.
A lateral and creative thinker, with passion for delivering bespoke concepts to meet a client’s needs
Highly numerate, with close attention to detail
Outstanding verbal communication and organisation skills
Exceptional negotiation skills and a proactive, agile attitude
Ability to handle multiple projects, prioritise assignments and meet deadlines
Ability to work efficiently in an extremely busy environment
Well rounded people management skills and experience

Who youll be working with

As the digital innovation, consulting and transformation business of the Capgemini Group, Capgemini Invent helps CxOs envision and build whats next for their organizations. Were located in more than 30 offices and 10 creative studios around the world, and our 6,000+ strong team combines strategy, technology, data science and creative design with deep industry expertise and insights, to develop new digital solutions and business models of the future.

At Capgemini Invent, we believe transformation begins with invention and ends with results. This inventive thinking helps clients unlock new opportunities and create whats next for their organisations. Ideation and prototyping are key, but so too is helping our clients to scale and industrialise new solutions. The fourth industrial revolution is forcing businesses to rethink their strategy, business model and offerings to their culture and everything in between. While emerging technologies such as artificial intelligence and blockchain continue to evolve, many organisations are still in the dark as to how and where they might be integrated. Capgemini Invent help our clients address these challenges by designing and creating advanced, real-world digital solutions and the business models of the future, resulting in new value creation and driving their growth.

The focus of your role

We are looking for a ServiceNow Director to join the People and Organisation team. You will be part of the Future of HR team delivering successful programmes across both Government and private sector clients. Consultants in this role will be dynamic in their approach and able to manage change with personality, precision and predictability to help realise measurable, positive business outcomes.

Youll be a part of a team that helps our clients reinvent the way they work to process human capital management and drive change across their businesses, with a focus on user-centric HR models.

What youll do

Working within the P&O team involves advising on significant business and organisational change that utilise our leading practice methods, tools and techniques. You'll make change "stick", ensuring sustainable benefits are realised by our clients, through your ability to have personal impact and skill in application of our methods. You will focus on the transfer of capability and also contribute to the strategic direction of the Capgemini Future of HR team. You will deliver end-to-end transformations for workforce programs, services and processes to identify, build and incentivise clients to drive success of organizations and their workforces. You will use your knowledge and experience of HR operations, HCM systems and the ServiceNow HR Service Delivery (HRSD) platform to help clients optimize their HR operations and drive business results.

What youll bring

You will come from a recognised consultancy background and youll have a desire to continue the growth in the consulting sector, and youll bring knowledge and experience gained by working with ServiceNow as a tool either in ITSM or HR.

As a Director, you will be responsible for new business / sell on consulting opportunities in excess of £2m per annum. You will play a leadership role in our wider business, helping set the direction, driving forward the business, model our values and behaviours, and coach and develop junior members of the team.

Experience:

You will have a good grounding in some or all of the following areas:

The ServiceNow Now Platform
Functional capabilities of the market leading core HCM solution, including SAP SuccessFactors, Workday, and Oracle
Delivering process redesign, functional design, and requirements for HCM solutions
Functional capabilities of the ServiceNow HRSD, including its Employee Service Portal, Case and Knowledge Management, and Enterprise Onboarding and Transitions applications
Establishing user journeys and creating user stories to support the design and configuration of ServiceNow HRSD
Development of HR strategies, Operating Models, and Service Delivery Model Design tailored to an organisations business requirements
Key trends in HR driven by both the evolution into an Intelligent People-centric function, and external shocks (including COVID-19, Brexit, and legislative changes)

You will also require:

Strong management consulting experience with proven success in ServiceNow.
A proven track record in new business development / account management across the full sales lifecycle; you will have a personal sales target of circa £2m per annum of consulting business.
Proven ability to be successful in a matrixed organisation and to enlist support and commitment from peers in selling and delivering consulting solutions.
Credibility and personal impact being driven, dynamic, tenacious and possessing the will to win and deliver results.
Versatility and collaborative in style, empathetic in nature, confident in content and focussed on outcomes at all levels in the client organisation.
A passion to shape, motivate and deliver.
Personal attributes:

To be successful youll be intellectually strong, highly motivated and a self-starter. You will be bringing a proactive, can-do attitude to project delivery, and youll be capable of working independently as well as in teams in our collaborative but sometimes demanding project environment. Youll need to be credible, with the gravitas to engage effectively with C-level / CXOs on a peer to peer basis. You will be collaborative in style, empathetic in nature, confident in content and focussed on outcomes at all levels in the client organisation. In fact, youll thrive in this environment. Youll demonstrate consulting professionalism and flexibility - youll be able to adjust positively to situations that involve changing tasks and/or location, shifting priorities or ambiguity.

Whilst you will have London as an office base location, you must be fully flexible in terms of assignment location, as these roles may involve periods of time away from home at short notice.

We offer a remuneration package which includes fixed salary, and in addition for Senior Consultant and above, you will receive variable compensation dependent on company and personal performance. We also offer flexible benefits options for you to choose to suit your own personal circumstances.

Capgemini positively encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion or belief, marital status, or pregnancy and maternity. We are committed to hiring, developing and retaining the best people to deliver innovative, world-class solutions for our clients. We foster an inclusive culture that enables everyone to achieve their full potential and enjoy a fulfilling career with us. Our comprehensive flexible benefits package and lifestyle policies enable our employees to balance their individual, family and work-life needs.

In order to commence a role with Capgemini UK plc you will be required to provide documentary proof prior to joining the Company that you are entitled to live and work in the UK.

The Head of IT Shared Services is accountable for the effective and cost-efficient delivery of IT Shared Services for employees across the Bank. This role is responsible for Service Operations, Application Support, Infrastructure, Operational Control and Asset & Change Management and leads a function of over 100 people.

This role is accountable for both the BAU running and future transformation of the area. You will be expected to enhance our service offering to the business, find cost effective solutions for the future, whilst identifying a road map to transform our services, in keeping with the overall IT strategy.

The transformation of our IT Shared Services is a strategic priority for the Close Brothers Bank and imperative to help us to provide best in class and cost-effective IT solutions to help our business units thrive.

Another key priority for this role is to enhance the security and resilience of our infrastructure and applications team, working in conjunction with the CISO.

This role needs to form influential relationships with our Exco, Security & Resilience teams and the business unit CIO’s to drive the agenda for change.

Key Responsibilities:
Strategy

Set the strategic direction for IT infrastructure services in a manner that supports and advances the Bank’s IT Strategy
Agree a shared IT Infrastructure Strategy with Business aligned IT Heads
Manage and drive our current and future IT infrastructure service providers
Oversee the successful delivery of all IT infrastructure projects to time and budget. These will include the move of applications to the cloud, both public and private.
Manage the portfolio of change of our BAU refresh strategy alongside the business change agenda
Build a successful engagement with the IT Applications teams and the wider business community
Develop and implement technical strategy and R&D for IT infrastructure
Create, implement and advance standards for technology for all in-scope technologies
Manage operating costs, striking an appropriate balance between price and performance
Work with stakeholders to identify service improvement and innovation opportunities and oversees the creation of service roadmaps

Delivery

Programme and Project Management: Ensure that business colleagues have appropriate information to allow project prioritisation, maintaining a rolling programme of forward-looking projects and costs
Develop business case justifications and cost/benefit analyses for IT initiatives
Deliver on time and schedule with early anticipation and escalate of issues
Ensure project planning anticipates key areas of complexity so that these are addressed in a timely manner within the programmes of work
Ensure that solutions and services are provided by the most appropriate and cost-effective individuals, teams and / or third parties
Ensure appropriate planning of both direct and indirect resources to match multiple business needs and efficiency of allocation to smooth any peaks and troughs of demand
Define and implement appropriate communication and engagement procedures with all levels of the business; organisation of the IT team and its processes
Ensure delivery of service meets all the security requirements and has all the necessary auditable IT controls in place, in line with the Risk framework
Develop the engineering blue prints to support the delivery of the end user compute product in line with evolving business requirements
Responsible for the delivery of all ITIL functions, including Release Problem, Incident and Change

Governance and reporting

Produce regular reports showing performance of key IT services
Manage financial aspects of the IT team including budgeting, monitoring of ongoing expenditure versus budget and financial reporting.
Negotiate and administer vendor, outsourcer, and consultant contracts and service agreements.
Establish and maintain regular written and in-person communications with the organisation’s executives, department head and end users regarding pertinent IT activities
Ensure customers are kept at the heart of the business by carrying out all activities skilfully, diligently and with proper regard to the interests of all our customers.

People

Leadership and engagement for a function of circa 120 people
Recruit, train and employ high calibre employees within budget, headcount levels and temporary resource requirements
Ensure there is an effective strategy for talent development. Coach, mentor, and develop staff, including overseeing new employee onboarding and providing career development planning and opportunities
Provide oversight and direction to employees in accordance with the firm's policies, procedures, standards and SLAs
Hold regular one-to-ones with direct reports ensuring that feedback is provided in a constructive way whilst working with the employee to facilitate personal development
Ensure that an effective performance review is operated in line with department guidelines, including setting objectives, personal development planning and performance standards with all direct reports
Working with the Group CEO and HR Business Partner to develop a culture of performance management, improvement and appraisal as a foundation for excellent organisational performance
Manage all departmental HR issues including monitoring absenteeism, and managing any capability and disciplinary issues
Ensure that team members complete online training when required and are kept abreast of any internal communications

Risk & Compliance

Ensure that all Governance and Compliance requirements are adhered to and all reporting and reviewing activities required by the Regulatory Bodies are carried out to the standards required.

Job Title: Director of Application and Cloud Security
Job Description:
We're looking for a hands-on Director of Product Security to build and own the Product Security team, a blended, business-wide AppSec and CloudSec practice within a rapidly growing and increasingly global Information Security and Risk team, reporting to the Head of Information Security & Risk.

You'll spend your time:
developing and investing in a first-class Product Security team and transparent, inclusive guild to find and engage stakeholders from every department
building and monitoring the 'paved road' that delivers a frictionless experience, allowing all of our delivery teams to work in a secure manner by default
defining and driving strategy and delivery of application and Cloud security across a highly DevSecOps oriented, multi-Cloud, SaaS-first environment
collaborating with our Engineering, Research, Infrastructure and Corporate IT leaders to rapidly and fundamentally transform the security posture of the business
creating and evangelising a best-in-breed, full-stack SDLC governance programme
representing Snyk in the DevSecOps and appsec/cloudsec community
You should apply if you:
have extensive experience and a genuine passion for building and running cutting-edge AppSec and CloudSec programmes and teams
are a compassionate, people-oriented leader who knows how to get the best from teams, sustainably, and are motivated by enabling the success of those around you
understand the value of automation, orchestration and scalability in a hyper-growth technology business
are happy to travel once a quarter to spend time working face-to-face with other colleagues that aren't co-located with you, as well as building strong online relationships when the pandemic doesn't allow travel
have excellent presentation skills, with experience presenting to top executives
We'd especially love to hear from you if:
you have experience leading geographically distributed teams
are confident representing your agenda and opinions in a business full of engaged, passionate people
you are passionate about building products that developers love and believe that DevSecOps is an outcome, not a role
you want to jump onboard a rocketship and help us achieve amazing things over the next two years. (Seriously, ask us about our plans in the interview!)
We value diversity at Snyk, and would particularly encourage applications from those who are traditionally underrepresented in tech. If you like the sound of this role but are not totally sure whether you're the right person, please apply anyway!

Interested?


Please apply below! We care deeply about the warm, inclusive environment we've created and we value diversity - we welcome applications from those typically underrepresented in tech. If you like the sound of this role, but are not totally sure whether you're the right person, do apply anyway :)

About Snyk


Snyk's mission is to help developers use open source code and stay secure.

The use of open source is booming, but security is a key concern (https://snyk.io/stateofossecurity/). Snyk's unique product enables developers and enterprise security teams to continuously find & fix vulnerable dependencies without slowing down, offering seamless integration into Dev, DevOps and DevSecOps workflows. We care deeply about the quality and usefulness of the tools we develop, always focusing on our customers and users.

We are experiencing rapid growth - and we want you to join us! By September 2020, Snyk was already adopted by over 1.5M developers, including multiple enterprise customers (such as Google, New Relic, ASOS and others). Our September 2020 Series D funding round of $200M has put us at over $2.5Billion company valuation.

We believe open source software is a force for good, and we're building Snyk to make it easier for developers who aren't security experts to stay secure.

Experience required to be considered:
A deep understanding and passion for the gaming sector.

Track record building, scaling and leading high performing technology teams.
Comfortable working with distributed teams.
Strong software engineering background.

Actively involved in the tech community and up-to-speed on latest industry trends and innovation.
An inspiring leader, with a collaborative, democratic and commercial approach.

Xero is a beautiful, easy-to-use platform that helps small businesses and their accounting and bookkeeping advisors grow and thrive.

At Xero, our purpose is to make life better for people in small business, their advisors, and communities around the world. This purpose sits at the centre of everything we do. We support our people to do the best work of their lives so that they can help small businesses succeed through better tools, information and connections. Because when they succeed they make a difference, and when millions of small businesses are making a difference, the world is a more beautiful place.

As the Market and Competitive Insight (M&CI) Director, you will be part of the global strategy team and will be responsible for developing a global, comprehensive view of the market and competitive landscapes in which we operate. This work will support rapid and thorough strategic and tactical decision making. You’ll conduct independent research of our competitors, gather first hand feedback from our sales teams, gather input from across several business functions and use this to draw insights and develop recommendations to help drive our strategy.

What you’ll do...

- Monitor the market environment to assess economic, political and regulatory environments and determine how they will impact our business.

- Assess our key competitors across regions to capture a global perspective including assessing our current activities could play out in future strategies of our competitors.

- Engage with team members across regions and functions to capture regional perspective

- Build upon existing processes to provide consistent coverage of M&CI across both topics and regions.

- Aggregate and synthesize information and research from across the company and provide the ‘company view’ on market and competitive insights in a succinct format.

- Create and deliver standard reporting to Xero’s leaderships team and board of directors

- Deliver proactive, actionable insights across the organization. Regularly engage with strategy teams and senior leaders to help inform key organizational decisions


Success looks like...

- Clear articulation of the operating environment, focused on changes and how they impact Xero and our customers
- Global alignment across stakeholders of the current situation and what it means for Xero
- Regular influence on key decisions through input into strategic projects and product prioritization
What you’ll bring with you...
Competitor assessments (both current position and strategic goals / direction)
Independently manage research (both online and in person) Draw conclusions and develop key insights from multiple information sources
Develop recommendations to respond to changes in our operating environments
Ability to synthesize information and recommendations to communicate with senior leaders
Product development process and technologies
Strong teamwork and cross-functional team influencing skills
Experience and proficiency in meeting and presenting to senior staff
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Proficient in MS Office and/or G-suite and other analytical tools
Team-oriented, self-motivated, success-driven, roll-up-your-sleeves attitude

Why Xero?

At Xero we support many types of flexible working arrangements that allow you to balance your work, your life and your passions. We offer a great remuneration package with benefits that support a range of lifestyle choices and requirements and the opportunity to participate in Xero’s success through our Long Term Incentive scheme. Xero has rapidly expanding offices in London, Milton Keynes and Manchester and our work environment encourages continuous improvement and career development.

Our collaborative and inclusive culture is one we’re immensely proud of. We know that a diverse workforce is a strength that enables businesses, including ours, to better understand and serve customers, attract top talent and innovate successfully. We are a Stonewall Diversity Champion, and Disability Confident committed. So, from the moment you step through our doors, you’ll feel welcome and supported to do the best work of your life.

Job Title: Senior Account Director | Healthcare Policy, Advocacy & Public Affairs
Job Description:
Hanover is a leading award-winning communications consultancy that advises enterprises, institutions, and individuals on building recognition and enhancing reputation.

We are a collective of smart, curious people that think differently. We live by our shared values. These guide our work and build our inclusive, open and collaborative culture.

We sum it up in two words: UNCOMMON SENSE.

Our remarkable growth is driven by our teams across Europe and the Middle East working together with clients in pursuit of a single goal. So we’re thrilled that this has been recognised by the London Stock Exchange Group (LSEG) in their report on the 1000 Companies to Inspire Britain, which identifies the fastest-growing and most dynamic SMEs in the UK.

Hanover is part of AVENIR GLOBAL’s powerhouse of specialist communications consultancies.

Find out more about Hanover and working for us.

ROLE OVERVIEW

We are looking for an experienced Senior Account Director to join the Healthcare Policy, Advocacy & Public Affairs team.

The Senior Account Director will provide strategic advice to Hanover’s existing clients together with management of client accounts, teams and budgets, backed by operational support where required.

They will also lead on new business activity including acquisition, development and pitching. In addition, they will personal manage, coach and mentor more junior team members up to Senior Consultant level.

The Healthcare Policy, Advocacy & Public Affairs team work with the most exciting healthcare and life sciences organisations, responsible for some of the most important breakthroughs in medical science.

This fast-growing practice has been an integral part of the Hanover Group’s overall growth and kept track with the Group’s 25% average annual growth rate over the last five years.

With over half of the world’s top 20 pharmaceutical companies, as well as NHS providers, health technology businesses and charities amongst our clients, we offer a diverse and compelling range of issues and opportunities.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Provide timely and relevant strategic advice to clients informed by broad intelligence-gathering on client, sector, and competitor environment
Supervise and support team’s delivery on a range of accounts
Provide advice and support on both team and client issues, in consultation with Associate Directors and Account Directors
Proactively build strong client relationships with senior client contacts and larger accounts, regularly monitoring client satisfaction levels
Identify and evaluate research needed to support new business pitches, writing tender documents and supervise the development of all materials required for pitches
Contribute to the achievement of the cost management target for each year through quarterly review of service levels making recommendations regarding team capability and capacity to service accounts
Personal management, coaching and mentoring of junior members of the team, up to Senior Consultant level, providing guidance on professional development, quality of work and overall efficiency
Requirements
Proven track record of experience working within either a public affairs consultancy, in-house public affairs department, patient group/NGO, Parliament or other relevant organisation
A strong understanding of the evolving NHS landscape and health policy as well as of the challenges facing the pharmaceutical industry
Public affairs and market access experience with corporate issues and pharmaceutical brands
Good insights and knowledge of pharmaceutical pipelines and the next generation of innovative medicines for patients
Strong management and mentoring skills
Good presentation and pitching skills
Proven new business development and networking abilities
A strong personal network of contacts across politics, policy, NHS, third parties, and industry
Experience of leading teams, including managing, coaching and mentoring more junior staff members
Strong track record of working across most aspects of the communications mix to include public affairs, policy, market access and corporate affairs
Benefits

In addition to a competitive salary, your core benefits package will include:
An annual performance-related bonus plus additional bonus potential linked to recruitment, new business and long service
25 days’ annual leave (plus bank holidays)
Private healthcare insurance
A company pension plan, including 5% employer contribution (optional upgrade available)
You’ll also have access to a wide range of opportunities and initiatives, including:
Flexible working policies, plus eligibility to apply for a sabbatical after 2 years’ service
Summer Fridays finish (3pm) – early Friday finish the rest of the year (4pm)
The Hanover Academy, which incorporates training, coaching, mentoring and reverse-mentoring opportunities to support personal development and career progression across all levels, with a generous training budget
International secondments as well as the opportunity to collaborate with all offices across the AVENIR GLOBAL’s network
A wellbeing programme, featuring (but not limited to) pre- and post-maternity leave coaching, a working parents’ group, mental health awareness training for our leadership team, Employee Assistance Programme, subsidised gym membership, LiveSmart sessions on mindfulness, sleep, etc.
Our Culture Club, with a robust social calendar all year round, Trailblazer of the Month award, Lunch & Learns, pub quizzes, monthly massages and an opportunity to win an Out of Office activity fund
CSR activities, including cooking for the homeless and providing pro-bono support to charity organisations
Hanover is an equal opportunities employer, committed to encouraging a balanced workforce within our company and the wider industry.

Salesforce Industries Go-To-Market (GTM) Director, Media & Telecommunications, EMEA
Location – Central Europe/UK (remote or at a Salesforce Office)

Salesforce Industries is a global team of industry experts, which is accountable for industry strategy, solutions and go-to-market in key industries such as Financial Services, Manufacturing, Retail and Media & Telecommunications. We support our regional sales and solution teams on their path to significant growth in the region and are a critical element for brand awareness and success within the respective industry.

The Salesforce Industries GTM team achieves this through:
engaging with our top accounts across different roles and levels of hierarchy
supporting the account teams through industry expertise and enablement
speaking slots at Salesforce and external events
creating industry-specific solutions and content and taking it to market
collaborating with the partner ecosystem for joint thought leadership and campaigns
The GTM Director is the customer-facing arm of Salesforce Industries and works closely with regional sales leadership, the account teams and our most prominent customers to drive awareness, pipe and ACV (Annual Contract Value). The GTM Director, Media & Telecommunications, EMEA will play an instrumental part of our solution and GTM strategy for Europe, Middle East & Africa. This role requires a strong point of view and supporting strategy for the Media & Telecommunications industry, as well as an understanding of industry-specific marketing and messaging for different markets in EMEA. The ideal candidate therefore would have had operational experience at a leading telco company and/or a premier Media company as well as at the CMT Practice of a Tier 1 strategy consulting firm. A clear grasp of Salesforce's solutions and capabilities for the CMT market and the ability to share our vision of the industry to C-level customer executives are essential for this role. This leader will be key in maintain relationships with regional sales leadership and work very closely with regional Industry Business Development, Marketing, Enterprise Architecture, and Solution Engineering Teams, leveraging the Global Industry Marketing and Go-To-Market teams to drive a consistent global strategy.


Role & Responsibilities

In this high-profile role you will maintain, specify and execute our GTM strategy for the Media & Telecommunications industry in EMEA. You’ll report into Salesforce’s EMEA GTM Lead for Media & Telecommunications and cover the following areas:

Sales and Strategic Account Support
Become the key point of contact for Media & Telecommunications sales topics in the region and a trusted business partner for sales leadership and the strategic account teams;
Provide direct, hands-on support to the top strategic accounts in EMEA, providing bespoke industry expertise in a customer-facing capacity to develop and progress large sales opportunities. This account support can be extended to other accounts with large opportunities;
Develop and execute scale plans for the next tier customers in close cooperation with Industry Business Development.

Industry Growth and GTM Ownership
Take personal responsibility for supporting the growth of solution pipeline and ACV in the CMT market segment along with the direct sales organization;
Coordinate and collaborate closely with regional leadership (sales, marketing) to support the development of the GTM business plans including target accounts, marketing strategy and programs to achieve target ACV growth;
Monitor pipeline progression, join forecast calls and review meetings with mainly local/regional industry sales teams, follow-up gaps and proactively recommend actions to cover gap;
Successfully bring together a virtual cross functional team including Industry Business Development, Sales, Industry Marketing, Sales Enablement, Field Marketing, Product, Partner and ISV teams to develop and execute the strategic plan for Telecommunications in EMEA.

Internal and External Industry Awareness
Articulate the industry challenges and opportunities, and evangelize the value of Salesforce and our solutions for this market internally and externally
Present at Salesforce events and 3rd party conferences to large customer audiences on industry topics and with customer
Command the attention of C-level executives and earn their trust through expertise and relevance
Contribute to the EMEA Media & Telecommunications Communities within Salesforce EMEA for aligning our sales teams
Organize training sessions, presentations by customers to our teams and run enablement workshops
Present to and consult with Salesforce local and EMEA management on business trends with a view to developing new industry programs and demand generation activities
Conduct and publish relevant customer and industry research to support our brand, messaging and industry sales teams

Solution Development and Delivery
Develop industry specific solutions and content for customer positioning, field enablement, and campaigns as needed to achieve industry goals;
Deliver agreed services to accounts and opportunities as prioritized by EMEA leadership;
Identify and adapt the industry sales assets (sales plays, industry trends, C-level challenges and strategic value of technology) and enable all customer-facing teams on these assets.

Skills / Attributes Needed
15+ years of industry expertise working in and/or selling into the Media & Telecommunications industry with knowledge in
Media & Entertainment: Ad sales, ad tech, OTT/DTC, production, content and rights management
Telecommunications: customer experience, customer-facing channels, customer care as well as overall BSS and OSS understanding
Well versed in overall Media & Telecommunications challenges and technology trends and have significant in-depth knowledge and experience in use of technology in Media & Telecommunications; ideally with an industry brand name, prior experience at a software company that created solutions for these industries or in the CMT practice of a tier 1 Strategy Consultancy.
Superior track record of collaboration and being a trusted advisor to the sales organization to win strategic deals
Ability to convince customers to jointly launch innovative solutions built on the Salesforce Platform and ecosystem
Held an active role in a firm's digital transformation, through the use of technology and business process improvements
Speaking the language of the customer and the ability to present the industry concept internally (e.g., to Sales teams) and externally (in front of senior client or at events)
Ability to succeed in a highly de-centralized matrix organisation; ability to lead and influence extended teams without formal line-reporting authority
Experience in dealing with senior leaders plus good networking skills
Entrepreneurial spirit and confidence to pick up and lead new projects
Proven track record in performing well in a fast-paced environment and crafting compelling positioning, thought leadership content and sales assets
Very strong public speaking skills
Strong analytical background and hands-on experience; the ability to think and act both at very strategic and at very tactical levels
MBA preferred, but not required
Business fluency in at least two European languages
Willing to travel inside EMEA to support on-going activities and key opportunities (% of time was 40% pre-COVID; currently not predictable/pending on COVID-19)

Zebra People are very excited to announce that we are exclusively working with D-Ford London, the innovation hub of Ford to help them find a Director of Software Design / Creative Technologist to head up and build a team working on some of the most complex transportation challenges out there.
The client
As a Software Design Director, you understand code as your creative design medium, with a deep empathy for the end user’s needs. You lead the team through an iterative digital prototyping process, building in order to understand what is desirable and feasible. Your methods will inspire teams to be creative with possible digital solutions and enable product and service testing with real users.
As a Software Design Director you will…
+ Help teams iteratively bring to life product and service experiences through proofs of concept and at varying levels of fidelity, exploring tools and methods to learn and evolve concepts through digital and physical prototyping.
+ Define and guide teams in standards for agile ways of working, stewarding exploration and delivery of concepts and prototypes along digital service delivery plans.
+ Look beyond any immediate technical barriers to push our thinking and make recommendations on how to build modern technology, services and ventures.
+ Lead the software design community, inspiring their growth, and definition of craft, pushing their thinking and processes.
+ Ensure project success by keeping a regular pulse on various project teams, providing design feedback, guidance and mentorship in service of delivering digital services that help teams think, learn and evolve the strategy of products, services and business opportunities.
+ Maintain awareness of emerging talent needs of software designers, product managers, and delivery managers, investing in their capabilities by supporting the learning and development and helping to attract and retain talent.
+ Effectively influence internal stakeholders and external partners through informal and formal channels, in service of designing, building and launching great software pilots and products.
+ Connect high-level business goals and strategy to tactical implications for product definition, managing competing constraints, stakeholder expectations and talent needs.
+ Lead in the continued development of the lab’s strategy, culture, internal relationships, and
external presence.
+ Ensure that digital service design capabilities are understood and accessible across Ford as we evolve our approach to designing and developing products, services and ventures that shape Ford’s role for the future of mobility.
YOUR QUALIFICATIONS
Basic Qualifications:
+ Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Business, Engineering or equivalent experience as a practitioner of software development.
+ 10+ years’ experience in software design and software engineering, preferably in a startup environment, with demonstrable experience leading technical teams as an experienced practitioner of agile software development, knowing how to get the best out of multidisciplinary delivery teams.
+ 2+ years’ experience working with human-centered design or with design teams.
Preferred Qualifications:
+ Master’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, or a related
field, or equivalent experience.
+ Experience as a product manager, digital technologist, chief technology officer, or related position.
+ Experience of utilizing design thinking and/or human-centered design in a formal, in-person
setting.
+ Track record of building and running great digital services that creatively work with existing systems and business models to meet user needs.
+ Experience of working across engineering and design teams.
+ Experience of organizational change and digital transformation initiatives within large and small corporations.
+ Passionate about automotive and transportation industry.
JOINING D-FORD
A bit about us
We’re in the midst of the biggest change the automotive industry has ever seen.
Just as cars changed the world over the last century – creating the driver, highways, gas stations, and malls – self-driving cars, electric powertrains, and connected vehicles will radically reshape how we live, work, and play, our cities and society themselves, in the next hundred years.
At D–Ford, you’ll be at the heart of creating that future. You’ll be at the cutting edge of Ford’s most strategically critical work, designing people and society’s needs into the heart of our next generation of products, services and experiences.
You’ll also be designing at scale. Every day, Ford’s vehicles and services support millions of people around the world. So, at D–Ford, we’re not just inventing the future, we’re operationalizing it, to help all those people move through their lives, better.
OUR PURPOSE
We drive human progress through empathy, creativity and design.

OUR VALUES
Our values are our guiding light, and the conscience for our work, and our people. We’re looking for
people who share this way of being – you don’t need to be convinced of it, you just get it:
ZOOM OUT
We are curious about the world, designing systems and connections that enable people to move more freely.
AMPLIFY OTHERS’ VOICES
We are inspired by the people around us, bringing their unique stories to the forefront of our designs.
PUSH THE EDGE
We provoke new ways of thinking about tomorrow’s toughest design challenges, while grounded in what’s possible.
GET SCRAPPY
We build in the open, rigorously testing, iterating and evolving our ideas with others.
BRIDGE THE GAP
We radically collaborate across teams, geographies, and philosophies, uncovering new insights
to tomorrow’s problems.
WILD CARD
Our strength comes from bringing our whole selves to the community—from introspective to playful or quirky. What will you bring?

BRING YOUR T
We don’t hire “Design Thinkers.” We hire T-people. You:
+ Have deep expertise in a craft
+ Are comfortable working in relatively flat and dynamic teams
+ Are passionate to work on ambiguous and complex future challenges
+ Have a collaborative and empathetic mindset to solve problems with teams across Ford
Alongside everyone’s role as a designer of world class design content, you will also be expected to
contribute to a range of communities to maintain our creative culture. We call these Community Hats.
They can range from stewarding the lab, leading a workshop, mentoring others, contributing to publications, hosting a tour with executives, bringing your maker skills to build prototypes, or leading your craft in a global community of like-minded designers.
These global communities will ensure that we stay connected across the organization, and constantly push the impact of what we do. They can act as additional areas of responsibility, helping to push careers in different directions.
We have four global labs: Palo Alto, Detroit, London and soon, Shanghai.

You’ll be part of a growing organization in the heart of Ford’s Product Development Center to drive
innovation from the inside out.

WORKING AT FORD
The distance between imagination and … creation. It can be measured in years of innovation, or in moments of brilliance. When you join the Ford team discover all the benefits, rewards and development opportunities you’d expect from a diverse global leader. You’ll become part of a team
that is already leading the way, with ingenious solutions and attainable products – and it is always ready to go further.

Excellent knowledge of Renderman and other unbiased rendering systems

Job Title: Director - Technology Media Telecom Focused Telecomm Architect
Job Description:
Director – TMT Focused Telecomm Architect

EY Technology is a fast growing Technology brand. We are recognised as a leading provider of differentiated technology consulting services harnessing new disruptive technology, alliances and talented people to solve our clients’ issues. Technology transformation is focused on helping our clients understand their needs and how to enable technology effectiveness across the organisation throughout the entire IT lifecycle. We create a vision for technology and how it can bring together innovative solutions that will support our client’s ability to achieve their strategic objectives.

We are looking for talented people who embrace technologies and want to make a difference for our clients.
The opportunity

EY helps clients transform and grow their business. This role is at the heart of that ambition, helping clients to shape innovative solutions which deliver results. We are looking for an individual who has a proven track record architecting complex solutions in the Telecommunications sector. Someone who has deep technology expertise and who can lead the conversation with senior business leaders to help them achieve a return on their Transformation investment. This person will build on experience of leading solution architecture teams and is now seeking to develop their commercial experience and impact with senior clients.

We are looking for skills and experience in architecting, designing and implementing either in the OSS (Operational Support System) layer or in the BSS (Business Support System) layer. We are looking for candidates who can lead a conversation with our senior clients, both with technical teams and also with the executive.

You will be engaging with our clients' senior executives, business representatives, and technology teams to understand current state business and technology landscape and developing pragmatic solutions.

EY operates across all industry sectors, and this role offers the opportunity to build experience and bring your wealth of technology expertise to clients in new and diverse projects, each with their own unique set of challenges.
Your key responsibilities

In your role as a Director within Technology Transformation you will have responsibility for:
Engaging with clients’ at senior levels across the organisation (both business & technology)
Architecting, designing and implementing effective technology solutions that enable value and growth across the client’s business
Identifying new technologies which can make a material impact on the sector and competitive advantage
Explaining technology trends and vendor roadmaps in terms for business impact
Supporting and managing high performing teams, taking responsibility for delivery
Sharing knowledge and equipping others with greater sector knowledge
Developing proposals, responding to client requirements, providing subject matter expertise
This role will be based out of the UK with flexible working arrangement. This role require travel from time-to-time to both domestic and international locations depending on client needs.

Skills and attributes for success

The role requires excellent business and technology understanding, as well as significant experience in the implementation and delivery of technology. Candidates should be able to demonstrate first and foremost a track record of working in the Telco sector to architect technology solutions. In addition, we are seeking candidates who can evidence a broader consulting skill set.

This is a leadership role where you will be expected to lead high performing teams, be a thought leader in your field and proactively contribute to the ongoing development of the EY technology practice. An ability to develop cutting edge solutions, bringing clarity where there is ambiguity is required.

We are looking for a highly motivated, articulate individual who has experience of the whole technology lifecycle and is passionate about designing innovative solutions to solve complex business problems.

What working at EY Offers

We offer a competitive remuneration package where you’ll be rewarded for your individual and team performance. Our comprehensive Total Rewards package includes support for flexible working and career development, and with FlexEY you can select benefits that suit your needs, covering holidays, health and well-being, insurance, savings and a wide range of discounts, offers and promotions. Plus, we offer:
Support and coaching from some of the most engaging colleagues around
Opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career
The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you
EY is committed to being an inclusive employer and we are happy to consider flexible working arrangements. We strive to achieve the right balance for our people, enabling us to deliver excellent client service whilst allowing you to build your career without sacrificing your personal priorities. While our client-facing professionals can be required to travel regularly, and at times be based at client sites, our flexible working arrangements can help you to achieve a lifestyle balance.

About EY

As a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and consulting services, we’re using the finance products, expertise and systems we’ve developed to build a better working world. That starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities and creative freedom to make things better. Whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime.

Join us in building a better working world.

Apply now.
