Job Title: Director | Healthcare Policy, Advocacy & Public Affairs
Job Description:
About us

Hanover is a leading award-winning communications consultancy that advises enterprises, institutions, and individuals on building recognition and enhancing reputation.

At Hanover we are united in our common belief that good healthcare is one of the most important things we can have, and we want to play an active role in evolving and improving it.

We are a collective of smart, curious people that think differently. We live by our shared values. These guide our work and build our inclusive, open and collaborative culture. We sum it up in two words: UNCOMMON SENSE.

Our remarkable growth is driven by our teams across Europe and the Middle East working together with clients in pursuit of a single goal. So we’re thrilled that this has been recognised by the London Stock Exchange Group (LSEG) in their report on the 1000 Companies to Inspire Britain, which identifies the fastest-growing and most dynamic SMEs in the UK.

Hanover is part of AVENIR GLOBAL’s powerhouse of specialist communications consultancies.

Find out more about Hanover and working for us.

ROLE OVERVIEW

We are looking for a Director with excellent leadership skills to join the Healthcare Policy, Advocacy & Public Affairs team.

The Director will work with a raft of the leading players in the pharmaceutical and healthcare sectors and will operate across a range of different disciplines including public affairs, government relations, market access, policy, corporate affairs and wider stakeholder engagement initiatives.

As a senior leader in the team, they will play an integral part in driving the wider health business and agency forward as well in managing, coaching and mentoring team members. They will also work seamlessly with colleagues in both our Healthcare Communications and International Policy & Market Access teams to provide clients with a fully integrated offering and develop creative, breakthrough programmes to deliver client objectives.

Hanover Health has been an integral part of the Hanover Group’s overall growth and was a triple award recipient in 2019, with wins at the PRWeek Awards, SABRE EMEA Awards and PharmaTimes Awards. The practice has also been recently nominated for PRWeek 2020 Specialist Consultancy of the Year.

The team works with the most exciting healthcare and life sciences organisations, responsible for some of the most important breakthroughs in medical science. With over half of the world’s top 20 pharmaceutical companies, as well as NHS providers, health technology businesses and charities amongst our clients, we offer a diverse and compelling range of issues and opportunities.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Provide a comprehensive and complementary strategic overview of all client and prospective client services ensuring they are informed by broad intelligence-gathering on client, sector, competitors and policy environment
Provide broad and detailed client counsel on relevant political environments and advise how they might contribute effectively to the political process
Demonstrate an active and ever-expanding new business network in the UK that can provide significant business development opportunities including cross-selling and up-selling with the other offices within the Hanover Group
Maintain regular senior level client contact to build relationships and identify any relevant opportunities and threats
Identify and evaluate research needed to support new business pitches, writing tender documents and supervise the development of all materials required for pitches
Work with the Talent team in identifying potential employees to join the team
Nurture, inspire and lead the wider team, including through agreeing a training strategy for all individuals
Undertake financial management, including invoicing, monthly accounts and budgeting
Drive quality assurance and standards, and the implementation of relevant policies and procedures across the team
Take responsibility for team internal communications, co-ordinate regular team meetings and other internal announcements
SKILLS & EXPERIENCE:
Proven track record of experience working within either a public affairs consultancy or an in-house public affairs department within either the pharmaceutical industry, Government agencies or civil service.
Significant experience developing and delivering public affairs strategies and programmes such as launching new medicines and therapies, delivering work in partnership with the NHS and working with patient groups
A strong understanding and insight into the major issues and policy changes affecting the UK healthcare system and pharmaceutical industry (particularly pricing, NICE and commissioning structures and processes)
Comprehensive understanding of political environments and processes at different levels, and direct experience of UK central government, Westminster and Whitehall operations along with EU institutions
Good insight and knowledge of pharmaceutical pipelines and the next generation of innovative medicines
An excellent network and reputation within the industry
A keen interest for, and experience of, business development, including identifying opportunities, developing strategies, proposals and materials for new business pitches
Experience of leading teams, including managing, coaching and mentoring more junior staff members
Strong track record of working across most aspects of the communications mix to include public affairs, policy, market access and corporate affairs
WHAT WE OFFER:

In addition to a competitive salary, your core benefits package will include:
An annual performance-related bonus plus additional bonus potential linked to new business and long service
25 days’ annual leave (plus bank holidays)
Private healthcare insurance
A company pension plan, including 8% employer contribution
You’ll also have access to a wide range of opportunities and initiatives, including:
Flexible working policies, plus eligibility to apply for a sabbatical after 2 years’ service
Summer Fridays finish (3pm) – early Friday finish the rest of the year (4pm)
The Hanover Academy, which incorporates training, coaching, mentoring and reverse-mentoring opportunities to support personal development and career progression across all levels, with a generous training budget
The opportunity to join our bespoke leadership development MBA programme
International secondments as well as the opportunity to collaborate with all offices across the AVENIR GLOBAL network
A wellbeing programme, featuring (but not limited to) Employee Assistance Programme, pre- and post-maternity leave coaching, a working parents’ group, mental health awareness training for our leadership team, subsidised gym membership, LiveSmart sessions on mindfulness, sleep, etc.
Our Culture Club, with a robust social calendar all year round, Trailblazer of the Month award, Lunch & Learns, pub quizzes, monthly massages and an opportunity to win an Out of Office activity fund
CSR activities, including cooking for the homeless and providing pro-bono support to charity organisations.
Hanover is an equal opportunities employer, committed to encouraging a balanced workforce within our company and the wider industry.

Who you’ll be working with
As the digital innovation, consulting and transformation business of the Capgemini Group, Capgemini Invent helps CxOs envision and build what’s next for their organizations. We’re located in more than 30 offices and 10 creative studios around the world, and our 6,000+ strong team combines strategy, technology, data science and creative design with deep industry expertise and insights, to develop new digital solutions and business models of the future.

At Capgemini Invent, we believe transformation begins with invention and ends with results. This inventive thinking helps clients unlock new opportunities and create what’s next for their organisations. Ideation and prototyping are key, but so too is helping our clients to scale and industrialise new solutions. The fourth industrial revolution is forcing businesses to rethink their strategy, business model and offerings to their culture – and everything in between. While emerging technologies such as artificial intelligence and blockchain continue to evolve, many organisations are still in the dark as to how and where they might be integrated. Capgemini Invent help our clients address these challenges by designing and creating advanced, real-world digital solutions and the business models of the future, resulting in new value creation and driving their growth.
The focus of your role
You will be part of the leadership team to provide Architectural and business expertise in finance. Providing transformational analysis of business requirements along with design and consultation in full solutions within your area of expertise.

You’ll work effectively in mixed client and consultancy teams, whilst acting as key member of the sales team to represent the solution offering to the client. Helping to recruit, coach and develop skills and capacity within the wider team.
What you’ll do
Role Competencies:
Detailed knowledge of business requirements and solutions in their focus area.
Mobilise and motivate a project team.
Ability to organise and co-ordinate diverse groups in complex situations.
Broad content experience across multiple lines of business.
Broad technical appreciation – including ALL key SAP functionality and technology. With ability to rapidly assess new technology solutions.
Lead functional / technical architecture in complex SAP and non-SAP environments.

Strategy & Science

Despite the pandemic the job market remains strong among small, high-growth pharmaceutical companies that are developing new treatments in specialty markets. We are working with one such organization as they expand their business in the Respiratory market. This dynamic company discovers and develops unique, small molecule therapies that feature multi-site binding properties and target only diseased tissues, reducing risk for side effects. They currently have one specialty product on the market and three more to launch over the next two years, and are now expanding their commercial strategy team. Although it’s still a very small commercial group, this is a dynamic, exciting work environment and their teams have unusually strong personal chemistry. If you’re looking for a strategic marketing challenge in an organization that is building a strong foundation for the future, this could be the opportunity for you.

The Role

The Director / Sr. Director of Commercial Strategy will lead the new product planning and pipeline strategy for a franchise of products used to treat asthma, COPD, IPF, and COVID-19. Duties include analytics, market research, forecasting and the development of value-based Target Product Profiles. You will provide commercial direction to clinical teams to identify which projects to initiate in their discovery process. You will assist in clinical trial design to optimize product value, and also work with medical affairs on publication planning and advocate development activities within the respiratory community. As products move toward launch you will also work with the marketing team on segmentation, product positioning and branding.

The small size of the commercial team means you will “wear many hats” in this high-profile assignment. The position currently has one direct report and will be adding another within six months. A key driver of success in the role will be the ability to lead cross-functional teams from across the organization to collaborate in a data-driven decision making manner. You will work with analytics staff on forecasts and valuation models as part of portfolio management within the respiratory market, and you’ll select and manage vendors for primary and secondary market research projects. This is a small, fast-paced environment so we need someone who is strong technically as well as strategically, and who is willing to “roll up their sleeves” and execute programs. This is a high visibility role with significant opportunity for career development and advancement.

10+ years of strategic marketing and pipeline planning in the Biotech or Pharmaceutical industry
3+ years of pipeline strategy in the Respiratory or Pulmonary market
Bachelor’s degree or better is required; MBA or advanced degree in the Life Sciences is preferred
The ability and interest to advance to the VP level within three years

An attractive compensation package for this position includes a highly competitive base salary, an annual bonus based on company and individual performance, and an expanded equity package in the form of restricted stock units and stock options.

This is an opportunity to leverage your technical experience and relationships for something more than a simple paycheck. If this sounds like the type of environment you are seeking at this point in your career, and if your background meets these qualifications, please apply.

One of the largest divisions in the Firm, Operations is the first line of defence for Morgan Stanley's financial and reputational well-being and essential in delivering value to our clients. Job Title: Executive Director - Chief Data, Information & Intelligence Officer
Job Description:
Location
12 Endeavour Square, London, E20 1JN

Division
CEO's Office

The Role
The Financial Conduct Authority has been driving significant organisational, people, process and technology change in order to continue its evolution towards becoming a regulator of the future. This involves the ability to use data more effectively to drive our regulatory decisions and build greater internal cohesion across a wide variety of financial services industry players, as well as a broad remit as set by our statutory objectives. Significant improvements in digital enablement, business intelligence, market data, knowledge and information management maturity are being pursued in order to allow the FCA to remain a world leader in financial services regulation and a data driven organisation.

The CDIIO will be a member of the FCA Executive Committee (ExCo), directly accountable to the CEO. The successful candidate will participate fully in high-level FCA management initiatives and, by doing so, will be pivotal in shaping and improving the organisation’s strategic and operational performance.

They will be responsible for ensuring that the digital strategy, delivered by the Director of Technology, is consistent and aligned with the aims and ambitions of the data and I&I strategies.

The role holder will drive the leadership and management of data and digital development to support the safe and efficient design, implementation and use of informatics solutions to deliver improvements in the quality of delivery and outcomes of regulatory, enforcement and associated enabling functions.

The CDIIO will own the FCA Data and Information Strategy and will be responsible and accountable for executing associated plans, ensuring coherence with the Bank of England, Treasury and other associated regulators or infrastructure bodies.

What does the role involve? What are the key responsibilities?
This is a unique opportunity to join an internationally respected financial services regulator at a critically important time in the organisation’s development and the financial services sector and to influence its transformation into a regulator fit for the future.

You will need broad and deep data and analytics experience, combined with the leadership experience to influence the wider strategy, and the ability to engage with senior leaders.
Significantly enhance the FCA’s ability to analyse and utilise the large volumes of data which it collects on the firms it regulates (60,000 firms). The Executive Committee wishes to continue to develop sophisticated analytics to make better use of this data and to allow enhanced regulation across the largest to the smallest of the regulated entities.
Develop and maintain a clear and accessible view/ framework of what categories of information are being used, for what purposes, and with what controls and ownership. This is to help people across the organisation understand the full FCA picture, but also to identify potential areas of challenge or opportunity for greater efficiency and improvement of process, insight or approach.
Lead a central Information and Intelligence (I&I) centre of excellence that works with teams across the business to collaboratively improve management of I&I across the I&I life-cycle – identifying local actions and thematic interventions required. Lead on implementation of more thematic interventions (e.g. sponsoring systems changes or driving new approaches to cross-FCA responses to harms)
Lead provision of a service for people across the organisation to highlight areas of potential harm-related concern that are not currently being addressed or have been de-prioritised but may need further review. Ensure the central team is recording these, prioritising and actioning appropriately – either directly or through local teams.
Business owner for key information, intelligence and insight systems, ensuring cross-divisional needs are represented and that systems are adopted and utilised as intended across the business.
This is a unique opportunity to play a key role in a major transformation within an organisation that sits at the heart of the UK Financial Services industry. This is a critical and highly visible role with the ability to have impact not only within the organisation but across the sector as a whole.
Alongside the FCA Senior Leadership team peers, continue to drive forward our diversity and inclusion agenda, building a highly inclusive culture ensuring colleagues thrive and organisational outcomes are met.
Organisational leadership - You will work closely with the CEO and your peers to deliver the FCA’s Mission

What will the candidate get from the role?
You will join the FCA’s Executive Committee at an exciting period of change for financial services and its regulation. You will have the opportunity to shape and lead a department of talented and committed people working collaboratively on significant projects and programme of work. You will get exposure to a broad range of issues and will contribute to the wider FCA’s senior leadership team, helping to shape and influence the organisation’s strategy.

Skills/Experience Required
Minimum

We’re a signatory to the Government’s Disability Confident scheme. This means that we guarantee an interview to any disabled candidates entering under the scheme, should they meet the minimum criteria for a role. A minimum criterion needs to be measurable from reviewing a candidate’s CV.
Systems and digital expertise, with proven experience in using data for better technological use, as well as applications integration
Significant track record of working in an environment with high data collection and utilising it in developing a more cohesive organisational strategy
Proven written and verbal communication and influencing skills at executive and board committee levels on issues of broad ranging and technically complex information.
At minimum, an insight into the collection and use of intelligence within organisations with a high volume of critical and sensitive data gathering.
Role model strong leadership behaviours in line with the FCA values and capabilities, embedding the Mission and delivering organisational priorities.
Essential
Extensive experience of leadership and people management, with the ability to inspire and motivate teams through a growth mindset
Exceptional relationship management and communication skills, with the credibility and breadth of vision to operate at all levels of the FCA and ability to earn the full trust and confidence of colleagues
A highly strategic thinker, with the ability to develop and communicate an exciting vision of the future and adapt their communication approach for different audiences
The ability to understand and synthesise a wide range of stakeholder views, constantly listening whilst remaining focussed on the overall goal.
The ability to meet challenging deadlines in respect to both time constraints and budgetary pressures
A strong quality ethic - experience of raising standards, effectively challenging with a view to finding common sense solutions to problems, and delivering high quality outcomes
Strong team management experience, including the ability to delegate and deliver through others
Desirable
Knowledge of the objectives and activities of the FCA.
Successful track record of integrating better cultural and data solutions into large and complex organisations.
Understanding of the financial services market in the UK and how firms operate within it.

About the FCA
We are creating a fair and more resilient financial system. We’re establishing more transparent relationships between financial services firms and their customers, building trust in financial markets and protecting vulnerable consumers.

The FCA’s Values & Diversity
Our ambition is to create a diverse and inclusive workplace that reflects the society we serve, helping us to be a better regulator. We serve the public and our decisions directly affect the wellbeing of people, businesses and the UK economy. So, our values matter. They represent the culture we aspire to every day, guiding our judgements, building trust and helping us to be ‘At our best’.

All FCA colleagues are expected to demonstrate behaviours in line with our five values – Deliver in the public interest, Act with integrity, Be ambitious, Work inclusively and Connect and deliver. These are embedded in all roles, and through the selection process we check for alignment to our values. For more detail on our values and core skills, please see here.

As an inclusive employer, we are open to considering flexible working arrangements. Please contact Rupert O’Donovan if you wish to apply for this role on a flexible basis.

Useful Information
The closing date for this role is 23.55 on 1st December.

Odgers are managing this role on our behalf.

To apply go to www.odgers.com/81217. For an informal, confidential discussion about the post, please contact Rupert O’Donovan.

Following shortlisting, selection will be via a two-stage panel interview, and half-day assessment with our executive assessment partners, Mercuri Urval.

Conflicts of interest

All applicants to the FCA are required to demonstrate that they do not have other interests likely to conflict with their responsibilities as an employee of the FCA.

You should declare any potential conflict of interest as early as possible in the selection process (via the named recruitment contact), and also disclose information or personal connections that, if appointed, might be open to misperception.

Any potential conflicts of interest will not prevent candidates going forward to interview but may, if appropriate, be explored during the interview to establish how the candidate would address the issue(s) should they be successful in their application.

For more information visit conflicts.

Job title: Director, Worldwide HEOR Markets ROW, Japan & Intercon Lead
Location: Uxbridge, United Kingdom
Division: Worldwide (WW) HEOR Markets Rest of World (ROW)
Direct Manager: Group Director, WW HEOR Markets ROW, Japan & Intercon
Position Requirements & Description:
The WW HEOR Markets ROW team works closely with key markets ex-US to deliver reimbursement/ access and demonstrate the value of our medicines. The WWHEOR Markets ROW Japan & Intercon team is part of the WW HEOR Markets ROW team and is dedicated to providing tailored cross portfolio HEOR support to Japan and the Intercontinental (Intercon) region, which comprises markets in Latin-America, Central Eastern Europe & Middle East, and Asia-Pacific.
Markets in Intercon vary greatly in the maturity of their healthcare systems, their reimbursement frameworks, and the external environment is rapidly changing: Japan has introduced a formal Health Technology Appraisal (HTA) process in 2019; The reimbursement process in China is fast evolving, with submission dossiers for national reimbursement now requiring HEOR evidence; Key markets such as South Korea, Taiwan, Brazil and Argentina keep on strengthening cost-containment policies through established or emerging HTA frameworks. In addition, Real-World Evidence (RWE) is of growing importance to regulatory, reimbursement and patient access decisions.
It is therefore essential that the successful candidate has significant HTA experience, in-depth knowledge of healthcare systems across multiple countries within the geographic remit, and a sound understanding of how health economic and real-world evidence can enable and support positive reimbursement decisions and broad patient access. The successful candidate must also be able to demonstrate strategic thinking, strong communication and leadership skills, and a history of business acumen, as shown by successful past experience collaborating with cross-functional stakeholders in a matrix organisation.
Key Responsibilities:
Deliver HEOR support across & within markets to enhance development of (long-term) integrated strategies and formulate HEOR activities & evidence generation that can enable timely, broad and sustained access to BMS medicines.
Provide expert advice to local teams on HEOR methods, HEOR considerations as part of the clinical development program, RWE generation and dissemination, regulatory and access issues. Identify important trends and anticipates future changes and their impact on HEOR and access strategies.
Define and implement HEOR activities (resource allocation, study plans, and timelines) in close collaboration with WW HEOR and VAP (Value, Access & Pricing) teams and in accordance with BMS Japan & Intercon Medical, R&D and Commercial/Access plans and priorities.
Proactively work with WW HEOR indication leads and key functions such as Medical, Commercial and Market Access in World Wide and local markets to ensure that HEOR activities to support Japan & Intercon are fully integrated in the WW HEOR plans as well as broader Medical and Access activities/plans.
Partner with WW matrix teams and local Market Access/HEOR teams to provide input into the planning of effective pricing and reimbursement strategies and HEOR plans to assist the maximizing of product lifecycle opportunities.
Facilitate and encourage efficient interactions between WW and local HEOR teams as well as ensuring timely and effective transfer of knowledge and expertise to and between local teams. Identify and realise synergies across markets.
Contribute to the development of local HE & OR/RWE capabilities. Promote local cross-functional understanding of HEOR, HTA and RWE.
Foster both informal and formal cross-functional and geographical collaboration and research, including WW HEOR Markets Japan & Intercon representation aligned with Japan & Intercon senior management, the WW Medical Team, WW Brand Team and Markets interface.
Act as a connection between WW and markets, influence across the enterprise creating effective and sustainable relationships within the matrix and positively influencing strategic development and commercialization decisions.
Collaborate with relevant local, regional and WW internal teams, as well as with external organisations (e.g. PhRMA) to influence and shape the evolution of the HTA environment. Leverage market-specific HTA/ payer insight to shape WW strategy and outputs.
Contribute to a high performing team culture.
Understand what is required to lead a culture of compliance with all appropriate policies and standard operating procedures; embed commitment to compliance within communications team practices; act as a role model demonstrating ethical and professional behaviour consistently.
Desire Experience/ Profile:

Significant experience with medical/clinical/scientific studies, as well as Health Economics, Health policy, Epidemiology or Outcomes Research. Demonstrated experience conducting outcomes research, health economics research, health services research, HTA or conducting observational studies across at least five markets within geographic scope.
Good working knowledge of healthcare market dynamics both in Europe and internationally. Knowledge of the drug development & commercialization process, HTA frameworks internationally, global reimbursement environment, and regulatory requirements. General experience and understanding of Market Access challenges internationally.
Track record of strong liaisons with international thought leaders in the area of HEOR.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, demonstrated by experience in communicating with senior stakeholders and past experience working successfully in cross-functional teams and matrices (especially between global and local teams).
Ability to balance strategic thinking with intricate planning and strong tactical execution; a good understanding of the key drivers of the business. Customer (internal and external) focused mind set.
Capability to manage multiple projects simultaneously. Ability to understand and respond to multiple internal and external customer demands.
Track record of problem solving, team leadership and people management skills.
Direct experience in leading, training and coaching colleagues or subordinates, particularly in a cross-cultural environment.
Proactivity and high level of personal accountability.
Strong project management skills – demonstrated by a track record of delivering relevant HEOR evidence, dossier adaptation, and scientific publications.
Fluency in English both written and spoken – Desirable: working knowledge of Spanish, Portuguese, Japanese or Mandarin.

Job Title: Chief IT Architect - Data & Analytics / Insurance Platforms
Job Description:
Location:
London

Geography:
Europe & The Middle East

Capabilities:
Big data & advanced analytics, Strategy, Technology & digital

Industries:
Financial institutions, Insurance, Technology industries

Who We Are


Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.

To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures—and business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.

BCG Platinion


As a seamlessly integrated part of the BCG network, we provide consulting services focused on the development and implementation of business-critical IT architecture and digital solutions. We create technology platforms and deliver exceptionally customized solutions of the future for our clients, from data strategies to next-generation customer journey solutions and transformational business models. We solve the most daunting challenges that companies face today and envision for tomorrow. Our style is entrepreneurial – nimble and innovative, with multifaceted, cross-functional teams and completely vendor-independent. Our unique selling proposition is technology expertise and delivery excellence.

Platinion was founded in 2000. Since then, we have grown continuously and successfully. Today we have offices in Europe, North and South America, Asia Pacific and Africa.

Practice Area Profile

BCG Platinion launched in Germany in 2000 to add deep technical expertise to the Boston Consulting Group’s existing capabilities. Today, our presence spans across the globe, with offices in Asia, Europe, and South and North America. Our New York-based North American team began in 2014 and in 2017 acquired MAYA Design, a Pittsburgh-based digital design and innovation lab, to grow our capabilities around technology and design. We support our clients’ total digital transformation through technology, design, cybersecurity, and risk management & financial engineering capabilities. And together with BCG, BCG Platinion’s interdisciplinary team of technical experts enable customized technical solutions and accelerate delivery value through new business platforms, application consolidations, and major system implementations.

What You'll Do

As a Chief IT Architect you will work closely with clients to understand their issues, define IT strategies, architecture solutions, win buy-in for your recommendations, and collaborate with fellow BCGers to transform client potential into performance. You will be given end-to-end responsibility for larger, highly technical and more complex "modules" within a project, and begin to develop specialised knowledge to help you solve client's problems. You will start to take on team lead responsibilities and demonstrate intellectual leadership.
YOU’RE GOOD AT

Developing & Designing

• Analysing complex IT application landscapes
• Analysing the status quo and optimization of IT architectures
• Identifying non-trivial technology decisions facing a client
• Storytelling about architectural building blocks and their importance
• Road mapping and business case development

Controlling & Managing

• Reviewing vendor proposals and/or in-flight technical work
• IT project management and quality assurance
• Optimizing application development processes

Building Community

• Advising internal colleagues on core technical concepts and frameworks
• Advising fellow architects on areas relevant to an area you have depth in
• Developing a network in the BCG technical community and leveraging it for our clients

What You'll Bring (Experience & Qualifications)

• 10-15 years' experience in software development, technical project management, digital delivery or technology consulting

• Ability to bring unique tech perspective from outside the consulting industry into BCG's typical engagements, requiring:
Consulting experience required
Strategic mindset (hypothesis driven,80:20 mindset, iterative approach, activist stance)
Self managed
• Strong knowledge of the UK insurance technology market with knowledge on core insurance processes and packages such as Guidewire, Duck Creek or DXC Graphtalk AIA, Sapiens, Keylane or SAP Insurance
• Must have core systems modernisation experience (Policy administration, claim systems, underwriting/pricing) and ideally regulatory reporting (Solvency II, IFRS 17)
• Strong experience on integration architecture (e.g. micro-services and APIs, streaming) and supporting technologies (e.g.Apigee, Microfocus, CA Layer 7, Tibco, MSFT API)
• Nice to have experience around Data and Analytics platforms (Cloudera, MongoDB, Hadoop), with knowledge on insurance data models and generic data platforms knowledge, Data Governance and Lineage
• Strong knowledge around Cloud platforms and data lake experience on AWS and Azure with familiarity around services that support data science environments as scale
• Extensive experience in assessment of IT target architecture in an enterprise environment, component technologies, and service-oriented architectures
• Leadership potential to transform the consulting industry in particular around interaction with designers, engineers and POs

Job Title: Director of Applied Science (Machine Learning and Computer Vision)
Job Description:
Onfido is the new identity standard for the internet. That means we only need an image of your ID and a selfie to prove that you’re you. In doing so, we help millions of people connect to the services they need and love more easily, speedily and safely than ever before, whether it’s renting a car or opening a bank account. Our vision is to create an open world where identity is the key to access.

We've received over $200 million in funding from world-class tech investors including TPG Growth, Microsoft, Salesforce to back our vision. And we're just getting started.

At Onfido, our AI scientists build the world’s most secure digital onboarding system used by thousands of businesses globally as the next generation of digital identity. We are looking for an exciting and dynamic leader who can lead our amazing team of AI scientists to push the envelope on several unsolved problems like uncertainty modelling, interpretable AI, protection against adversarial and Deep Fake attacks, differential privacy, bias mitigation, and generalised concept drift detectors within human-in-the-loop systems in service to our identity verification and digital identity products.

As a senior AI leader, you will support Onfido’s hyper-growth and passionately deliver real world value using state-of-the-art machine learning and computer vision techniques. We build fraud detection systems that operate at unprecedented performance levels with error rates of less than 1 in a million (99.9999% performance levels) while protecting against unknown unknowns? We detect thousands of fraud attacks daily in over a dozen industry verticals from banking to gaming to the crypto-world to shared economies and others. As businesses and services go online or maintain a purely online presence, secure, fast and reliable digital on-boarding is a necessary and enabling need.

At Onfido, we believe that identity is the key to access and therefore we are building the world’s most sophisticated identity verification system.
What you will be doing:
Be responsible for identifying customer needs and building products and services to meet those needs.
Build and develop the Applied Science team
Oversee and define the strategies, priorities and allocate resources to execute for delivery
Demonstrate ability to drive complex initiatives and deliver results in collaboration with engineering and product teams
Liaise and communicate high-level concepts effectively to internal and external stakeholders
Have strong executive presentation skills as well as strong written, communication and interpersonal skills
Have a track record of engaging with the academic community on CV and ML problems
Execute on submitting papers to top international conferences, grant writing and patent filing
Essential Skills and Requirements:
PhD or MSc degree in Machine Learning, Computer Vision or a related quantitative field.
Have an in-depth understanding of the technical and scientific issues
Extensive professional experience in building real world machine learning and computer vision applications.
Track record of successfully delivering high performance ML-driven products.
Have previously lead a team of machine learning specialists, working collaboratively with engineering and product management.
Successfully mentored people and teams to achieve their full potential.
Worked with customers to impactfully solve their problems.
Deep understanding of machine learning theory.
Good coding skills in Python (C++ is considered a plus) and hands on experience using at least one of the deep learning frameworks Tensorflow or PyTorch.

Desirable Skills and Requirements:
Technical experience in uncertainty modelling, explainable machine learning techniques, out-of-distribution detection, life-long learning, system design, interpretable AI and related fields.
Technical experience with conventional (non-DL) computer vision, signal processing and image processing techniques.
Working knowledge of cloud computing (preferably AWS) and tools and technologies such as Kubernetes, Docker, Git, etc.

Who We Are


Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.

To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures—and business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.

Digital BCG


BCG has a long history of driving growth by embracing innovation and new ways of thinking. Through DigitalBCG, we bring together a diverse mix of consultants and digital specialists to ensure that we are supporting our clients throughout their digital transformation journeys. We work with our clients to fully understand the impact of digital on their business and set priorities that will transform their vision into value. Whether it be developing new technologies to support their core business, making better use of their data, or pursuing entirely new sources of revenue, our aim is to achieve radical improvements in productivity, flexibility, and speed. We are innovating how our clients are using artificial intelligence, robotic process automation, internet of things, personalization, blockchain technologies, and more to gain competitive advantage.

DigitalBCG encompasses a broad set of data, digital, and technology capabilities from BCG consulting teams and practices, along with our business units such as BCG Digital Ventures, BCG Platinion, and BCG GAMMA.

What You'll Do

BCG’s Data & Digital offering is closely aligned to our Technology Advantage practice were we work with our clients (often CIOs and CTOs), to position companies for the future. The rapid advance of technology has resulted in an explosion of data in business. The ability to decode this data can unlock a higher level of insight and drive a superior level of performance. That’s where we come in.

With experts in Big Data, Digital Business models, IT strategy, and IT efficiency/effectiveness, we leverage digital solutions to power transformations that stick. We believe transformations fail when companies focus too much on the finish line and not enough on the capabilities that must be built in order to get there and—most importantly—to stay there. Our teams work with client members from all levels of the organization in order to integrate our staff's strategy, operational, and industry experience with the client's individual situation, culture, and unique constraints.

Data and Digital Platform Experts help our clients improve performance through the use of data and technology. The extent to which a company has made the transition to a digital organization determines its ability to effectively field data, extrapolate useful information, and act on it in real-time. By combining digital and data analytics expertise with battle-tested transformation experience, you will empower companies to make that leap.

In this role, you will drive the vision for target technology platforms that deliver on client business objectives, and outline an achievable roadmap to implementation. You will set the high-level structure for the transformation effort, manage to tight timelines and client deliverables, provide hands-on training, and deliver the key enablers required to complete the project. Your team will include senior BCG leadership, teams of BCG Consultants, and both junior and senior client leaders working collaboratively to facilitate the transformation.

The Expert Consulting Track (ECT) is vital to BCG’s ability to successfully meet our clients’ demand for deep expertise and advanced technical capabilities. Experts deliver next-level impact for BCG's most complex and cutting-edge client challenges. Experts focus on developing BCG's thought leadership, commercial capabilities, and intellectual property assets; and their work is essential to our delivery model. Working as part of a multidisciplinary team to bring the ‘best of BCG’ to our clients, Experts come from diverse backgrounds, with expertise often gained outside of BCG in industry, academia, or specialized consulting.

As an Expert Associate Director, you will apply your deep expertise to generate value for our clients while building and contributing to BCG’s intellectual capital. Your role in projects can vary from team management to team advisor. You will leverage your expertise to add insight and drive clients toward recommendations and you will be viewed as a trusted advisor by senior clients. You will help scope and structure the work, onboard team members, and provide guidance throughout the project. Expert Principals contribute significantly to BCG’s intellectual capital, generate interest and excitement about their expertise area, and coach and mentor others.

What You'll Bring (Experience & Qualifications)

We’re looking for exceptional talent from consulting or industry to join us. You would typically have:
A minimum of 8 years of experience in leading and managing large, complex enterprise-level technology transformations, with expertise around specific issues that arise with modernizing technology and data architectures (data lakes, in-memory databases, containers, microservices, and how these relate to legacy architectures, common ERP architecture. Overall, a demonstrated ability to translate analytics and digital strategy into data, technology, and operating model implications
Experience delivering large-scale transformation projects and successful implementation including staffing and leadership development while taking a hands-on approach with clients
An outstanding academic track record
A proven project and people leader with exceptional drive and commitment striving for excellence
Willingness to travel internationally and to work remotely on client sites
Excellent communication and persuasion skills

Our Expert consultants within DigitalBCG are an integral part of BCG's core consulting team; you will work side-by-side with all practice areas to create value & competitive advantage for our clients. Your team will include senior BCG leadership, teams of BCG Consultants, and both junior and senior client leaders working collaboratively to drive the transformation, and shared services/control functions. You will roll up your sleeves with clients to work through both macro and day-to-day problem solving in an agile fashion and often times, you will also work side-by-side with agile coaches in an apprenticeship model to help our clients develop their internal agile coaching workforce.

techUK Overview & Broadband Stakeholder Group Overview
techUK is a membership organisation that brings together people, companies and organisations to realise the positive outcomes of what digital technology can achieve. By providing expertise and insight, we support our members, partners and stakeholders as they prepare the UK for what comes next in a constantly changing world.
techUK houses several special purpose vehicles, including the Broadband Stakeholder Group (BSG). The BSG is the UK’s leading advisory body on broadband policy. It provides a neutral forum for organisations across the converging broadband value-chain to discuss and resolve key policy, regulatory and commercial issues.

Purpose
As Associate Director for Telecoms and BSG you would oversee all strands of techUK’s offerings in this area. This includes techUK’s telecoms programme, the Spectrum Policy Forum (SPF) and the Broadband Stakeholder Group (BSG).
This high-profile role would work in these three areas to develop crisp policy, regulatory and market development proposals to help drive the UK’s telecoms market and deliver world-class connectivity. You will be at the heart of key debates between Government, Regulators and the increasingly diverse vertical industries with an interest in telecoms, as well as techUK’s external voice on telecoms issues.
Both the Broadband Stakeholder Group and the Spectrum Policy Forum are special purpose vehicles within techUK’s organisation, with separate and more focused membership bases. techUK’s telecoms programme is made up of members from across its membership (from FTSE 100 companies to start-ups). The role would involve balancing the more evidence and report-based work of the BSG and SPF with a more events-driven, market development and campaigning based focus of techUK’s telecoms programme.
You would be responsible for financial targets in these areas as well as line management responsibility for a team of four; the Head of Spectrum Policy Forum, techUK’s Telecoms’ Programme Manager, the BSG’s Programme Manager and a shared Team Assistant. The position requires the ability to work with a large and diverse selection of external stakeholders, manage work spanning the full range of broadband policy issues, undertake and commission analysis of complex issues coupled with the ability to communicate and promote this analysis clearly and effectively to a broad audience.

Competencies

An effective mentor and manager of high-performing teams;
Strong interpersonal skills and good at building relationships;
Commercially-minded with an ability to convey techUK’s value proposition to members and sponsors
An effective communicator with excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to communicate information effectively to a range of audiences; and
Excellent organisational skills and attention to detail.

Person Specification
Essential Knowledge and Experience
A strong understanding of the UK’s policy and regulatory approach to telecoms;
In-depth knowledge of public policy and public affairs;
Experience of managing projects and external consultants; and
A proven track record and experience of building and managing relationships with a diverse range of stakeholders, including at the C-suite level.

Desired Knowledge and Experience
Strong interest in the UK tech sector and our mission to make the UK good for tech, make tech good for the UK and make tech good for people; and

Description

Vogue is looking for a highly-motivated, experienced and enthusiastic digital sales and strategy lead to join its dynamic commercial team.

This role presents the opportunity for an individual to join our fast-paced sales team and help develop our commercial digital opportunities - working closely with local and global stakeholders across the company to deliver new offerings and solutions to the British Vogue publishing team and help implement them. The successful candidate will be a confident communicator and negotiator and should have experience in developing digital opportunities within the publishing or media environment. This role will also require significant experience in commercial sales - to include both display and bespoke content creation as the appointed individual will also have a dedicated client and media agency portfolio to manage. We are looking for a self-starter who is keen to embrace the many facets of this role - whether it be in building and developing relationships with existing commercial partners; approaching new business prospects to sell proactively; or working closely to develop our digital offering in order to ensure continued growth across display and partnerships.

This is a fantastic opportunity to work in a fast-paced team, on Condé Nast’s flagship brand.

Key Duties & Responsibilities

Developing and establishing new digital opportunities for the British Vogue brand, and acting as a central liaison/manager for the sales team when assisting with their implementation.

Generating new ideas on behalf of the British Vogue commercial team and working to ensure these are sold effectively.

Seeking out and converting new business opportunities with a view to increasing revenue
Selling display advertising and partnerships across print, online, social and events – with extensive experience of each

Essential Skills & Requirements

An integral understanding of and experience in advertising sales - with a particular focus on digital (web, social and video), but also including print media
A passion for Vogue and an interest in the wider luxury market, with a particular focus on digital products and the offering of competitors

A lateral and creative thinker, with passion for delivering bespoke concepts to meet a client’s needs

Ability to handle multiple projects, prioritise assignments and meet deadlines

Well rounded people management skills and experience

Job Title: Global New Business Strategy and Proposition Director
Job Description:
Hungry? Ready for a challenge? Our restaurant partners are the lifeblood of the company and we are building out a dedicated function to drive the performance of a new business vertical within Deliveroo. Our restaurant technology products and commercial services provide our portfolio of +100,000 restaurant partners globally a path to long term growth: a key part of our mission to become the definitive food company.

As a New Business Development Strategy and Proposition Director, you'll be responsible for the strategy and development of a new product line from scratch, working with all markets and central functions. You'll be positioned within a newly created function, designed to accelerate the growth of a new business vertical for Deliveroo.

You'll develop and maintain the strategy for the new business vertical, work directly with our most important partners and act as a subject-knowledge matter expert to central and local teams. You'll own the voice of the customer, obtaining feedback from partners, driving go-to-market strategies and informing the product roadmap. Success in this role will require the development of effective working relationships with senior leaders across management, marketing, engineering, operations, legal and commercial teams across Deliveroo.

What you'll be doing
Leading the global strategy for a new business vertical -> Seen as the knowledge expert in the organisation
Market level commercial strategy -> Working with markets on creating the commercial strategy
Co-creating the roadmap with tech -> Working with product to identify and execute on future improvements and developments
Ensuring accounts are set up for success -> Creating successful account management frameworks to drive partner success
Requirements
7+ years of experience in strategy roles (either consulting or in-house)
Expert in Powerpoint / Slides and Excel and developing strategies from scratch with lack of perfect information
Experience collaborating cross-functionally and building consensus among multiple stakeholders in an entrepreneurial, high-expectation environment
Resourceful, action and detail-oriented, with a high ownership mindset to deliver measurable impact
Managed, or capable of managing, large cross functional projects and teams
Why Deliveroo?

When you first think about Deliveroo, you probably think of getting great food to your house in less than half an hour. Awesome right? But behind the scenes is the real story. This story is one of high growth, huge challenges and an enormous opportunity ahead of us. It began with our founder Will, arriving in London in 2004 and finding it almost impossible to order great food, despite the wealth of incredible restaurants in the city. In 2013 Deliveroo was launched. Fast forward to 2020 and we operate in 12 markets with over 60,000 riders who deliver orders from 60,000 restaurants in over 500 cities worldwide.

We want to be the definitive food company - the app you go to any time you have a hunger pang. We are transforming the way people think about food. We are providing people with limitless access to different cuisines and restaurants, turning cooking from a chore to a choice, and giving people the freedom to eat what they want, when they want, where they want it.

We work with riders, restaurants and consumers. We operate one of the most complex three sided marketplaces in the world and we do this in real time. Millions of customers and thousands of restaurants and riders rely on us to match them within milliseconds. The algorithms behind that marketplace are the secret sauce that allows us to deliver our orders in around 30 minutes.

And we're just getting started.

The scale of the opportunity ahead of us is immense. The global food market is valued at £7.7 trillion but only 1% of it is currently online. Contrast that with the digital disruption of countless other industries - from banking and travel to retail and communications - it's clear that our journey in the food sector has only just begun.

We are already a multi-billion pound company that has grown rapidly. Deliveroo came top in the FT's' list of Europe's fastest growing 1000 companies in 2018, and we were the first company ever to win Deloitte's 'UK Top 50' two years in a row. Yet most of the extraordinary value this company will generate lies ahead of us.

We want to be the definitive food company - the app you go to any time you have a hunger pang. We are transforming the way people think about food. We're a technology driven company at the forefront of the most rapidly expanding industry in the world, so come and join us for the ride.

Benefits and Diversity

At Deliveroo we know that people are the heart of the business and we prioritise their welfare. We offer a wide range of competitive benefits in areas including health, family, finance, community, convenience, growth, time away and relocation.

We believe a great workplace is one that represents the world we live in and how beautifully diverse it can be. That means we have no judgement when it comes to any one of the things that make you who you are - your gender, race, sexuality, religion or a secret aversion to coriander. All you need is a passion for (most) food and a desire to be part of one of the fastest growing startups in an incredibly exciting space.

Job Title: IT Business Relationship Director - Global Manufacturing
Job Description:
McCormick & Company, Inc., a world leader in the spice, flavor and seasonings industry, is seeking a full time IT Business Relationship Director, Global Manufacturing. This position reports to the VP of IT Business Solutions.

With more than $5 billion in annual sales, 40 factories and 25 distribution centers, McCormick manufactures markets and distributes spices, seasoning mixes, condiments and other flavorful products to the entire food industry – retail outlets, food manufacturers and foodservice businesses. We create differentiating flavors consumers prefer with unmatched quality, science, innovation and service. Every day, no matter where or what you eat, you can enjoy food flavored by McCormick. McCormick brings passion to flavor™!

As a company recognized for exceptional commitment to employees, McCormick offers a wide variety of benefits, programs and services. Benefits include, but are not limited to, tuition assistance, medical, dental, vision, disability, group life insurance, 401(k), profit sharing, paid holidays and vacations.

POSITION OVERVIEW:

As a Supply Chain IT leader, the Business Relationship Director (BRD) is responsible to drive the digitalization of manufacturing operations globally. The BRD works with business partners across McCormick globally to stimulate and shape demand for capabilities and solutions. This individual leads cross-functional teams to develop long-term plans, multi-million dollars business cases and capability roadmaps. Acts as a supply chain and technology expert by recommending strategic initiatives that enable the enterprise digital transformation and drive incremental business value. Provides technical leadership and coaching on solutions design, architecture, implementation, deployment and support.

In parallel to the supply chain digitalization, McCormick has engaged into a global business transformation and is implementing a new SAP-centered enterprise applications landscape. Within this program, this position is accountable to defining and delivering the manufacturing solutions for all manufacturing plants globally. This is a very large, complex, strategic and transformational program wherein the BRD is expected to play a critical leadership role and help shape the future of our company.

The ideal candidate excels at communicating strategies, capabilities, solutions, roadmaps and trends both inside IT and with business leaders up to C-level executives, in a form and level that each audience can consume.

This individual is responsible for the direct management of a global team.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Drive the business of IT

Partner with business leaders globally to:
Jointly shape technology needs, requirements and transformational opportunities to enable the global digital business transformation and boost business performance.
Measure adoption, business case realization and develop future capability roadmaps.
Plan new initiatives, evaluate ideas, and determine how they align with strategic plans, business capability roadmaps and priorities.
Partner with IT Global Solution Delivery, IT Global Infrastructure Services and IT Global Security to maintain visibility over the portfolio execution and align priorities.
Act as internal advisor and visionary on emerging technologies by recommending strategic projects that bring incremental business value.
Cost center and project budgets
Lead budgetary efforts necessary for securing appropriate funding to deliver the roadmap. Responsible to drive business case definition for strategic projects.
Accountable for the related technology cost center(s), budgeting technology projects and assistance in development of value propositions for solutions.
Technology strategy and architecture
Partner with Solution Architecture and IT Security on architecture strategy and technical innovation plans to support the IT vision with the business teams.
Seek innovative solutions and share them with the business, weighing all key factors such as business fit, strategic alignment, total cost of ownership, technological fit, compliance, security requirements and user experience.
Talent leadership and development
Actively manage performance and development of global team members, including developing goals and supporting employees with their development plans.
Mentor team to shape initiatives and work efforts to seek cost efficiencies and effectiveness for the business.
Innovation
By actively surveying technology and process innovation, identify, develop and embed technology and strategic capabilities that drive the digital transformation, profitable growth and/or competitive advantage for McCormick & Co. Drive innovation within the IT organization and the business through on-going evaluations of emerging or value-added solutions.
Leverage external sources, network and partnerships to identify best practice and offer progressive solutions that fuel business growth or create a competitive advantage.
Operational Excellence
Actively drive and is accountable for team adherence to company and department policies and standards including, but not limited to: Sarbanes-Oxley, IT General Controls and IT Operating Model (ITOM) processes.
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:
Academic
BA/BSc - Business or Technology field, or related discipline
Experience
Relevant experience in solution design, integration and/or development
Relevant staff leadership experience
Relevant budget and resource planning experience
Relevant experience in leadership role in or supporting the supply chain function
Relevant experience in full lifecycle SAP implementations, including deployments on a global scale.
Supply chain and supply chain technology acumen and hands-on knowledge, including Industry 4.0 (MES, WCS, …)
At least 1 Industry 4.0 (Manufacturing and/or Warehousing) full project lifecycle.
Innovation leveraging progressive technologies (e.g. AI, AR)
Track record of building and sustaining effective partnerships with business stakeholders, up to C-level executives.
Executive presence; ability to influence

Job Title: Office of Business Integrity and Ethics, Director, Northern Europe and Australia
Job Description:
Vertex Pharmaceuticals Ltd. is seeking an experienced Compliance professional to join its Office of Business Integrity & Ethics (OBIE). OBIE is responsible for the development, implementation, oversight, and continuous improvement of Vertex’s Compliance program. This includes defining standards via policies and procedures, creating and implementing training and communications, conducting auditing and monitoring and other assurance activities, facilitating internal reporting, discretely and professionally conducting compliance-related investigations, and keeping the CEO, the Executive Committee, and the Board of Directors informed on Compliance matters. OBIE serves as the go-to experts for Vertex employees and external stakeholders on issues relating to Vertex’s Compliance program and Code of Conduct globally.
Job Description
The Northern Europe and Australia Business Partner will serve as the primary point of contact for business colleagues across all regional Commercial, Medical, Clinical, Research, Development, and support functions. The Northern Europe and Australia region includes the UK, Ireland, Sweden, Denmark, Finland, Norway, Australia and New Zealand.
The role also provides Compliance oversight to the Oxford Research Center therefore the candidate will be expected to have strong knowledge of the research and clinical compliance framework.
The Compliance Business Partner will work closely with our OBIE Operations team and other regional Compliance Business Partners in further enhancing and implementing our Compliance program and will provide daily support to our business colleagues to ensure effective implementation and understanding. The Compliance Business Partner must have deep knowledge of pharmaceutical industry regulations, applicable local codes, and anti-bribery/anti-corruption laws and extensive experience working for biotechnology/pharmaceutical companies on these issues. Additionally, the Northern Europe and Australia Compliance Business Partner will work collaboratively and strategically with colleagues in OBIE, Legal, and the business to drive a culture of ethics and integrity across Vertex’s global organization.
The candidate will be expected to demonstrate an entrepreneurial spirit and high level of autonomy, able to self-identify compliance goals & objectives for their Region and requiring low supervision.
If you thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced, hands-on, and team-oriented environment where you can have a big impact on the organization, we’d love to speak with you!
Key Responsibilities
Serve as the point of contact for Northern Europe and Australia regional business colleagues seeking strategic and tactical guidance on matters of compliance, integrity, and ethics.
Provide Compliance oversight, guidance, and direction for regional business colleagues and identify areas where Compliance input and attention is required.
Maintain a high level of knowledge of current and emerging laws, regulations, codes, and recent enforcement actions and inform and educate business colleagues with tailored communications.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive fact- and risk-based decision making.
Help to establish standards and implement procedures to ensure the Compliance program is effective and efficient.
Develop and maintain strong relationships and collaborate frequently with Legal, Human Resources, Internal Audit, and colleagues in other functional areas both in and outside of the Northern Europe and Australia region.
Support continuous improvement of the Compliance program.
Skills/Abilities/Competencies
Ability to convey difficult messages to more senior positions than self and high level of confidence to navigate throughout organization matrix and hierarchy.
Consummate team player with excellent judgment and interpersonal skills.
Ability to communicate effectively with all levels of management and employees.
Demonstrable experience taking ownership of issues and providing timely, actionable guidance.
Strong oral and written communication and influencing skills and the ability to proactively and pragmatically collaborate cross-functionally.
Strong analytical, organizational, and problem solving skills.
Excellent project management skills with the ability to manage multiple priorities simultaneously.
Self-starter with demonstrated leadership skills and ability to meet goals given limited supervision; able to exercise sound judgment in balancing risks in ambiguous and complex situations and escalating matters appropriately.
Demonstrated superior ability to identify areas for improvement in controls, systems, and processes and implement effective solutions.
Ability to work with large amounts of data to analyze information while still seeing the “big picture”.
Confidence and professionalism to handle difficult conversations and discretion on sensitive matters.
Experience in Leading and Managing holistic projects in relation to Company Policies, procedures and processes, ideally in a Global position.
Experience in managing dotted reporting lines and/or project groups.
Understanding and exposure to compliance areas outside healthcare fraud and abuse such as Auditing & Monitoring, Privacy, Investigation
Minimum Qualifications
Extensive proven experience working for or in the biotechnology/pharmaceutical industry, with exposure in an in-house capacity
Solid experience working in a multi-jurisdiction and cross-cultural environment
Demonstrated experience in navigating Compliance framework in both Commercial and R&D environment
Knowledge of laws, regulations, and codes relating to healthcare fraud and abuse and regulated pharmaceutical products, specifically anti-bribery/anti-corruption laws and pharmaceutical regulations and guidances
Demonstrated strong commitment to compliance, ethics and accountability
Flexibility to work in a fast paced and dynamic work environment with a strong work ethic and positive attitude
Ability to travel approximately 35% of time
Proficiency in MS Office (especially PPT)
Preferred Qualifications:
Law degree and/or Compliance professional certifications and experience at a large, global pharmaceutical company preferred
