Experience of leading large scale global technology-enabled Finance and wider Corporate Services transformation programmes from assessment and strategy through delivery
Experience of leading the design and implementation of leading finance technologies (ERP & EPM systems, RPA, AI). Microsoft and Oracle being the preferred ERP technologies.
Operating model re-design and experience of shared services and outsourcing; Finance Business Partnering.
Leading and developing teams
Understanding our clients’ business and showing strong commercial acumen
A substantive track record of new business sales
Senior stakeholder management and relationship building
Desirable skills & experience
Experience of Lean methodologies for process/ cost optimisation
Experience of developing thought leadership, new methodologies and propositions in this area
Formal accounting qualification or equivalent understanding of accounting principles and processes.
Understanding of broader business services office processes and technology, i.e. HR, payroll, procurement, CRM.

Job Title: Consulting Director - Finance - National Government Services
Job Description:
We’re one of the world’s leading professional services organisations. From 158 countries, we help our clients, some of the most successful companies on the globe to create the value they want. We help to measure, protect and enhance the things that matter most to them.
In Consulting our business is transformation and we are known for our focus on and commitment to achieving results. We combine strategy, technology and management consulting expertise to help organisations succeed with an understanding of how business works and a knowledge of how the right technology in the right place can create competitive advantage.
Our Finance Team provides full lifecycle support to CEOs, CFOs, controllers and treasurers and other members of the CSuite to optimise the value delivered by their finance and broader business/corporate services/back office functions and to improve their contribution to the overall performance of the business.
The right person will have skills in technology-enabled Finance and corporate services transformation covering areas such as Finance, HR, Procurement, IT, with experience of selling and implementing technology-enabled global business services models. Typical technologies are Microsoft Dynamics and Oracle.

We deliver high value solutions, from strategy to execution, solving our clients’ complex business problems through technology enablement. These include:
Finance and business services operating model transformation (service and interaction models, organisation design process change, shared services, sourcing etc) from strategy and assess through to implementation
Driving value from technology to enable operating model transformation (Cloud ERP, Robotics Process Automation and AI, EPM, Consolidation and Reporting, Data Models, Priority Based Budgeting) covering all elements from vendor assessment and selection, architecture design through to systems and business integrator implementation.
Achieving business insight and achieving business growth
Changing culture in Corporate Services.
About the role:
This is a senior level appointment for a Director to be responsible for:
building relationships with our key clients within National Government Services
identifying client needs, proposing solutions to them and closing sales
leading the delivery of projects
developing the careers of the teams working with and reporting to you

Requirements:
Essential skills & experience
Consulting track record (ideally Big 4) with extensive experience & network within National Government Services
Experience of leading large scale global technology-enabled Finance and wider Corporate Services transformation programmes from assessment and strategy through delivery
Experience of leading the design and implementation of leading finance technologies (ERP & EPM systems, RPA, AI). Microsoft and Oracle being the preferred ERP technologies.
Operating model re-design and experience of shared services and outsourcing; Finance Business Partnering.
Leading and developing teams
Understanding our clients’ business and showing strong commercial acumen
A substantive track record of new business sales
Senior stakeholder management and relationship building
Desirable skills & experience
Experience of Lean methodologies for process/ cost optimisation
Experience of developing thought leadership, new methodologies and propositions in this area
Formal accounting qualification or equivalent understanding of accounting principles and processes.
Understanding of broader business services office processes and technology, i.e. HR, payroll, procurement, CRM.

The details:
A key member of the extended management team
A competitive salary commensurate with your experience will be offered
Based in our London office but with some travel to clients
Are you the right person?
This role will support InCrowd’s ambition to change the way in which sports organisations view and utilise data and technology to transform fan experiences and ultimately revolutionise their revenue opportunities driven through digital channels.
Our clients need someone who understands their business problems and can help to solve them. You will enjoy building relationships, creating trust leading to successful results for you and for your clients. You already know the world of digital marketing but want to build your career in a groundbreaking environment.
Candidate Criteria
Demonstrable sales and account management success in the areas of consumer data, technology and digital marketing.
Comfortable building and maintaining C-level relationships.
Sports fan, and very likely to have worked in a sports business environment in order to understand client requirements.
Consultative approach with clients with a core existing understanding of the use of data and technology to drive consumer revenue.
Ability to handle challenging client situations.
Organised and trustworthy.
Your written and verbal communication skills must be excellent.
Relevant educational and professional qualifications will be useful, but demonstrable practical success will be more important.
What will you be doing for InCrowd?
Manage the commercial relationship with Key Accounts
Act as advisory and consultative support to clients to drive their success
Maintain and increase revenue commitment from clients
Generate client success case studies
Manage contractual relationships
Generate leads from new and existing clients
Manage and support sales
Who are we?
InCrowd is a data-led fan marketing company, but first and foremost, we are sports fans. We understand the unrivalled passion and dedication of supporters towards the clubs, leagues and players they care about.
We use technology to capture real-time fan consumption data and have enterprise-scale third-party data integrations enabling our clients to gain a better understanding of their fans, going well beyond who they are and delving deeper into their behavioural habits and fan characteristics. This approach allows our partners to deliver relevant and timely content and marketing messages to fans, vastly enhancing the fan experience whilst achieving commercial objectives.
We work with multiple sports organisations and clubs including; Formula 1, ECB, 10 Premier League / Championship football clubs, Rugby Football League and Premiership Rugby. We have seen rapid growth in our five-year history and now have over 80 staff based in London and Brighton and now Australia.
This role will be a challenge but it is a rare opportunity to be part of a fast-growing start-up business offering progression potential, opportunity and personal growth.
We have seen rapid growth in our short history and now have a team of 80+ across London and Brighton as well as staff in Australia and Hong Kong.
What will InCrowd be doing for you?
InCrowd offers a healthy, friendly and creative environment. We are proud of our culture and excited about the next steps for the company.
We also offer:
Company benefits.
Support for additional training and education.
Social events.
Opportunity for significant career progression in a fast-developing team.
Up for the challenge?
Send us your CV and something that shows us why you’re perfect for the role. This can be anything; an email, a video or perhaps a case study of previous work….. we want to find out more about you. Email everything to jobs@incrowdsports.com and we’ll be in touch.

Who we are

Say hello to Doctor Care Anywhere: the digital platform that puts your health in your hands.

No more queuing outside GP practices. No more stressing over appointments. We help over 2.3 million people speak to a GP by video or phone, whenever or wherever they need to.

We’re a team of doctors, designers, data analysts, software developers, managers, marketers, and more – all working together to transform patient experiences for the better. And as we grow, we need the best kind of people making that happen.

Sounds like something you’d like to be a part of? We have ambitious goals and need ambitious people to reach them. If you’re talented, hard-working and ready to dream big - while having some fun - we’d like to hear from you!

Your new Role

Seeking a Technical Director to lead the design, development, testing, and deployment of the whole Technology function. Working closely with the Head of Product to drive a cohesive Technology and Product roadmap and working just as close with the broader organisation to support and drive the delivery of an effective, seamless and gold standard service.

You will join a growing team of exciting individuals, and take a leadership position across Development, Site Reliability Engineering and Quality Assurance, continuing the great work that is already being done and living and breathing the continual improvement in everything that we do.

Cross functionally you will work with clinicians, customer success team members, operations staff and the patient experience team to help us fulfil our purpose of improving people’s lives. You will also have a hand in our compliance and governance policies and procedures, and spend time with key accounts as part of business development opportunities.

This is a role with a broad remit and a real opportunity to drive change in healthcare.

The key tasks in your new and exciting role with us:
Lead the Technology team, working to optimise, improve and enable the best service possible.
Create processes for technical development and standards across all departments and develop methodologies for unified and cohesive technical development.
Create processes in order to ensure the best quality monitoring for all technology.
Identify and take ownership of leading on new opportunities for service development and improvement, instilling a culture of continuous improvement.
Work closely with all areas of the business ensuring cross collaboration on all Technical developments to deliver the best and safest patient care.
Be able to give accurate cost and development timelines for technology projects and developments, or articulate why other approaches may be beneficial.
Work with all teams to ensure the businesses continuity is maintained as best as possible during major incidents.
Lead and support the growth of the Technology teams in order to develop the team and maintain morale.
Coaching the team to taking an active role across all areas of the business.
Representing DCA as a subject matter expert on what we do, how & why we do it that way when meeting with 3rd parties.
Driving an agenda of education in all things tech both within the team, and across the company.
Hopefully a description of you and your experience!:
Experience having worked in a start-up would be beneficial
Previous experience working as a Technical Director leading strong teams
Strong development background with experience across all areas of a technology platform and lifecycle
A security first mindset, focused on delivering through rapid iterations
Ability to think creatively and solve unique and complex problems
Able to work on several projects at the same time and prioritise effectively
Good written and verbal communication skills
Good general business acumen (preferable experience in data-rich analysis-driven organizations)
Ability to build strong working relationships with peers and stakeholders
Commercially minded, able to take the lead in meetings with customers
Why you want to work here:

We understand the importance of good health and happiness for our patients and our employees. You can expect to be supported and valued as a member of out team and have the freedom to make the most of your role and careers with us! As part of that, as an employee you will have access to:

Benefits:
Free Private Medical Insurance
Doctor Care Anywhere subscription for you and 5 members of your friends or family
Bonus scheme!
25 days holiday + bank holidays
Competitive Maternity and Paternity leave
Bike2Work scheme (for all biking equipment - even if you don’t bike to work!)
Other plus's when at DCA!:
4 x charity ‘Care in the Community’ days per year
Progressive environment with a focus on wellbeing
An environment where the ‘sky is the limit’ offering career opportunities and development
Flexible working environment with the option of coming into the office for a collaborative space
Open, transparent and dynamic environment, trusted to work independently but with a great team around you
Virtual Fitness classes three times a week

Job Title: Head of IT Operations Carey Group
Job Description:
About The Opportunity

Are you looking for an opportunity to define the digital architecture and optimise business technology operations within a family-owned business? Do you have the technical acumen and team-management skills to challenge and enable an existing in-house team to deliver effective technology experiences and processes? If so, this is a chance for you to provide your expert knowledge, experience and innovative approach to support and develop the ‘Careys digital’ strategy. Now, let’s set the scene…

The Carey Group is a multi-faceted, leading Construction business, operating across the UK and Ireland. Our infrastructure is diverse- a mix of on premise, cloud and hybrid, utilising the full Microsoft stack. Our existing team is made up of Senior Technical Engineers, 2nd Line and Service Desk technicians (headcount of 10) and the Head of IT will lead this team, assessing and driving necessary change to ensure our infrastructure maintains pace with our fast-moving roadmap.

Reporting to the Chief Information Officer, this is a 6-month fixed-term role, helping to bridge the gap when re-defining our IT digital strategy and ‘steadying the ship’ amid an evolving company and IT team. When defining this strategy, there is a need to ensure the IT foundations and team performance metrics are clearly defined- a core focus of this role. Once this is in place, we anticipate the Head of ICT Operations role will become a permanent vacancy. In collaboration with the CIO, you will;
Lead the IT team, ensuring optimum performance for resolution of issues and change requests inc. setting KPIs and team performance management
Manage infrastructure projects using formal project management techniques to ensure offerings are bespoke, as well as on-time, within budget and quality.
Stakeholder/business partnering to evaluate internal IT functions and processes with a view to providing proactive and comprehensive solution-oriented support
Manage the disaster recovery for IT within the wider Business Continuity Plan
Define the IT infrastructure strategy, architecture, and processes to ensure that user requirements, data protection and security are met and technical developments which improve efficiency achieved
Produce KPI packs to communicate the performance of IT across the Group
Maintain and optimise the company’s network, servers, security, upgrades, installations and configurations of hardware and software
Assess infrastructure performance, resolve issues and recommend improvements
Control budgets (CAPEX and OPEX) and suggest ideas to reduce IT costs
Organise departmental training to improve employees' knowledge and skills for future growth
Provide business architecture and systems processing guidance
Create methods for compliance architecture, such as data storage, metadata management, and change control
Manage contracts with vendors and software licensing, ensuring all suppliers are regularly reviewed, in conjunction with Procurement
Troubleshoot hardware and software issues, manage upgrades and patching requirements
Define and implement best practice procedures for infrastructure housekeeping, equipment tracking, service level reporting, service & license auditing and supplier reviews
Assist, where necessary, the Design, Planning and Operations team in Tender submissions from an IT perspective and provide follow up and ownership of deliverables in successful tenders

About You

This role calls for a strong analytical and technical ability to successfully deliver timely and considered results through the empowerment and leadership of a diverse team. Definition and control of work process from beginning to end is necessary, coupled with a focus on developing bespoke, cost-effective and solutions-oriented ideas through business partnerships and systems/technology analysis.

Technical Skills
Excellent understanding of Network WAN/LAN, Wireless, Firewall and Security technologies
Extensive Microsoft Active Directory, Azure, Windows Server, Exchange and Office 365 skills
Excellent knowledge of Mobile Management Solutions, preferably Microsoft Intune
Strong knowledge of SharePoint functionality and other tools for collaboration within the Microsoft stack
Excellent knowledge of Domain Services installations and migrations
Srong technical skills in Microsoft System Centre Configuration Manager
Experience with virtualisation stacks – HyperV/WMWare including migration
Excellent understanding of SAN storage options
Strong technical skills in backup solutions, examples; VEEAM Backup & Replication, Symantic Backup Exec
Experience
Essential minimum of five years as an IT Manager, IT Operations Manager, Head of IT with direct responsibility of a small to medium sized team that delivers technology services and support
Experience of presenting to board level on technical subjects
Previous successful handling of critical infrastructure
Experience dealing with and negotiating technology contracts of values up to £500k
Experience of managing infrastructure projects within different environments, i.e. On Premise, Cloud and Hybrid
Demonstrated experience of Technology Project Management

Unique Benefits

37.5 hour week. Monday - Thursday, 9.00am to 5.30pm (1hr lunch). Friday 8.30am to 4.30pm (½hr lunch)
Agile working arrangements (home and Wembley HQ)
26 days holiday per annum + Bank Holidays
Private, family business with a strong social purpose and respectful culture
Ability to lead and influence within a newly defined role, directly interfacing with Senior Leaders
Flexi-care benefits: Tastecard, Gym Membership, Cycle2Work, Holiday Trading (buy or sell up to 4 days), Health cash plan

About Us

Carey Group PLC is an equal opportunities employer and positively encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, transgender status, religion or belief, marital status, or pregnancy and maternity.

Job Title: Director, Government and Public Sector, Technology and Digital Risk, Risk Advisory, London
Job Description:
Your Opportunity
All elements of our public services from our tax to our justice system are facing significant challenges as they seek to digitise ways of working and achieve Government ambitions to deliver services in an agile, inclusive and yet safe and secure manner. We specialise in working with our client to support them as they navigate this transformation journey, providing the digital confidence to vital public services for the better. Join our rapidly-growing Government and Public Sector, Technology and Digital Risk team and work with us in supporting clients as they progress on their digital journey.

Our team is passionate about making an impact that matters, to both our clients and the citizens that they serve. We are looking for likeminded individuals who have experience in senior roles in government, arms-length bodies, delivery organiastions or consulting companies and see the next step in their career with Deloitte.

Are you looking to return to the workplace after an extended career break?
For this role we can offer coaching and support designed for returners to refresh your knowledge and skills, and help your transition back into the workplace after a career break of 2 years or more. If this is relevant for you, just let your recruiter know when you make your application.

Your Role
We are seeking an exceptional individual, from industry or government, with hands-on experience related to the planning and assurance and delivery of technology-enabled transformation programmes. Experience of governance, risk and controls methodologies will also be beneficial.

As a member of our Government and Public Sector, Technology and Digital Risk team , you will have the commercial relationships, experience and capability necessary to lead and deliver technology and digital risk programmes working closely with other Directors, Partners and the wider public sector leadership team. The role will require you to maintain your relationships within the governmental bodies, and develop new relationships with clients to build a pipeline of new opportunities for the practice. The role will also entail developmental responsibilities, in supporting the promotion of exceptional individuals within the team around you in order to support our ambitious growth plans.

You will work closely with high-performing, experienced individuals, both within Deloitte and from our clients. Deloitte staff are frequently the individuals within our clients’ programmes who drive a step-change improvement in the speed and quality of delivery. We are looking for an individual with exceptional motivation, drive and commitment to achieve this positive impact for our clients and further build our reputation and brand.
Risk Advisory is one of the fastest growing teams in Deloitte. We can offer unrivalled career growth and learning opportunities. If you have a proven track record in any of the above disciplines either from Industry or Professional Services, we would like to speak with you.

The role will have responsibility for:
Leading client relationships, bidding and winning work across our chosen area of focus within the public sector
Developing new business proposals and having an integral role in industry and account teams.
Working with a range of client stakeholders, and being seen as a subject matter expert within client organisations and by colleagues, developing and maintaining deep industry relationships and knowledge.
Building collaborative relationships with peers and working closely with other government and public sector account colleagues across the firm to help clients solve complex issues.
Lead client projects by managing client relationships, developing the scope and engagement plan, managing team members, engagement financials, and overseeing the production of high quality deliverables.
Co-ordinating internal practice development by participating in proposition, methodology and point of view development activities and supporting knowledge capture and sharing.
The nature of work varies, but your work is likely to involve the following:
Working with senior leadership teams within government departments and arm length bodies to understand their challenges and develop proposals to address them.
Working with client leaders and their teams to design and delivery digital assurance programmes, including on key aspects of the digital lifecycle such as testing, training, system building and integration, implementation and optimisation.
Assessing the change impact and benefits of transformation programmes and supporting the development of innovative approaches and ideas to deliver organisational change through better use of technology across government.
Your work, your choice
At Deloitte we believe the best impact is the value we add, not the hours we sit at our desk. We carefully consider agile ways of working, both formal and informal, that allow for the best impact for our people and our clients. Please speak to your recruiter about the working pattern that works best for you.

Location:
London with occasional domestic travel

Work pattern:
This is a permanent contract opportunity.
The role can be worked on a full-time basis.
Your Professional Experience
Experience of working directly with one or more government department or large government agencies.
Strong technology qualifications and experience, including in programmes relating to the implementation of large scale technology projects.
Demonstrable experience of developing and managing senior level client and stakeholder relationships.
Evidence of bidding for and winning work to secure business growth.
Strong analytical and project management skills with experience leading and working in multi-disciplinary teams to deliver on high-profile and complex transformation engagements in a fast-paced project environment.
Excellent interpersonal skills and demonstrable ability to establish credibility fast with client and project teams.
Experience of developing junior staff and mentoring team members.
Ability to think creatively, generate innovative ideas, challenge the status quo and deliver effectively to ambitious requirements.
Your service line: Risk Advisory
In Risk Advisory, our thinking and actions give clients, our people and society the confidence to succeed responsibly in a rapidly changing world. We don’t just work with our clients to manage risk, we help them understand and grab the opportunities it presents too, helping them provide high-quality services. Our expertise and industry knowledge run deep here. At Deloitte, you’ll find yourself working with some of the most inspiring and experienced colleagues and with clients who trust you to lead the way to smart choices, better control frameworks, and new systems, including bespoke solutions that have a direct impact on their bottom line.

Your industry: Government and Public Services
The Deloitte Government and Public Services practice works with our clients to progress some of the most significant challenges in delivering services to citizens. From the Home Office, to Defence, healthcare to housing, we work with clients bringing insight and expertise from our global practice to address public policy, resilience, risk and large-scale change management issues to the benefit of society. We have a deep practice with expertise and relationships across government. Individuals joining our team will have the opportunity to work with experienced and senior individuals who together provide a market-leading advisory service to our public sector clients. Intelligent, empathetic and committed, you will focus on helping to address some of the most significant challenges facing our society, making an impact that really matters.

Personal independence
Regulation and controls are standard practice in our industry and Deloitte is no exception. These controls provide important legal protection for both you and the firm. We are subject to a number of audit regulations, one of which requires that certain colleagues abide by specific personal independence constraints. This can mean that you and your "Immediate Family Members" are not permitted to hold certain financial interests (shares, funds, bonds etc.) with audit clients of the firm. The recruitment team will provide further detail as you progress through the recruitment process.

About Deloitte

Our Purpose & Strategy
To make an impact that matters for our clients, our people and society - defines who we are and what we stand for. Our purpose provides the foundation for our strategy and our aspiration to be the undisputed leader in professional services: this is not about size, it's about being the first choice. The first choice for the largest and most influential clients, and the first choice for the best talent.
What do we do?
Deloitte offers global integrated professional services that include Audit & Assurance, Consulting, Financial Advisory, Legal, Risk Advisory and Tax Consulting. Our approach combines intellectual leadership, industrial expertise, insight, consulting & problem solving capabilities whatever the role, technology revolutions and innovation from multiple disciplines to help our clients excel anywhere in the world.
Beyond the UK: Deloitte North and South Europe
The UK is part of Deloitte North and South Europe (NSE), the second largest member firm in the Deloitte network. Deloitte NSE combines operations in Belgium, Central Mediterranean (Italy, Greece, Malta), Ireland, the Middle East (Bahrain, Cyprus, Egypt, Iraq, Jordan, Kuwait, Lebanon, Libya, Oman, Palestinian Ruled Territories, Qatar, Saudi Arabia, United Arab Emirates, Yemen), the Netherlands, the Nordics (Denmark, Finland, Iceland, Norway and Sweden), Switzerland and the UK. Deloitte NSE brings together 2,700 partners and over 50,000 people, combining our unmatched breadth and depth of capabilities in audit and assurance, consulting, financial advisory, risk advisory, and tax and legal across the region. Being part of Deloitte NSE supports our aspiration to be the undisputed leader in professional services and will create more opportunity and growth for our people.
What do we value?
What brings us all together at Deloitte? It’s how we approach the thousands of decisions we make every day. How we behave, our beliefs and our attitudes. In other words: our values. Whatever we do, wherever we are in the world, we lead the way, serve with integrity, take care of each other, foster inclusion, and collaborate for maximum impact. These five shared values lead every decision we make and action we take, guiding us to deliver impact how and where it matters most.

Being a Leader at Deloitte
Cultural fit and purpose-led leadership is crucial for Deloitte. Our leaders always set the example and inspire their colleagues. They make quality time for people and take an interest in them. They know what matters to people - both inside and outside work – and value them as individuals; always finding opportunities to develop them while showing respect and appreciation.
We expect colleagues at all levels to embrace and live our purpose and our leadership culture by challenging themselves to identify issues that are most important for our clients, our people, and for society and make an impact that matters. We know leadership comes in all shapes and sizes, but our Leadership Charter helps all of our people understand what we’re looking for:

We live our purpose: we act as a role model, embracing and living our purpose and values, and recognising others for the impact they makeWe develop talent: we develop high-performing people and teams through challenging and meaningful opportunitiesWe drive performance: we deliver exceptional client service; maximise results and drive high performance from people while fostering collaboration across businesses and bordersWe believe positive influence can make an impact that matters: we influence clients, teams, and individuals positively, leading by example and establishing confident relationships with increasingly senior peopleWe move, together, towards a strategic direction: we understand key objectives for clients and Deloitte, aligning people to objectives and setting priorities and direction.RTWPROG WPFULL SLRSKA CFTECH

DTTL and each of its member firms are legally separate and independent entities. DTTL and Deloitte NSE LLP do not provide services to clients. Please see www.deloitte.com/about to learn more about our global network of member firms.

Our Purpose & Strategy

Job Title: DIRECTOR/EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR – CORPORATE COMMUNICATIONS - AGENCY ROLE
Job Description:
Does the idea of taking your career to the next level by owning and growing a division excite you? Tired of being a small cog in a big wheel with limited autonomy? This role could give you the independence and freedom you crave to sky-rocket your career.
The Agency
This PR and content agency is part of a top wider marketing services group with a multi-offering across consumer, corporate communications, technology, influencer marketing and digital/social and a client list boasting some of the biggest blue chip names such as British Gas, Airbus, MoneyCorp, Network Rail, Ford and BP. The entire company is around 80 people and split into the aforementioned sectors with all working in an integrated, collaborative way.
We are looking for a Director to join the well respected Corporate and B2B practice to continue its momentum/winning streak of 40% growth year on year and a revenue in excess of £2million – not bad for a 16 person team!
As an agency, they aren’t one of the traditional corporate outfits that may immediately come to mind, making this a really interesting opportunity for someone looking for something different. Their USP is their blend of client programmes, offering a “corp-sumer” mix of expertise to challenge the rigid conventions of traditional corporate communications by blending aspects of B2B, corporate and consumer communications to help clients solve their challenges. Much of their work is integrated, often blending together disciplines such as media relations, digital content production, social media, influencer marketing, media training and thought leadership, events, public affairs and employee engagement.
Culturally, it’s strictly non corporate, very creative and collaborative with benefits including
Competitive salary
Income Protection
25 days holiday (raising by an additional day after 2 years’ service, to a maximum of 30 days)
Private Medical Insurance
Life Assurance
Permanent Health Insurance
Contributory pension
Performance related pay scheme (annual, after qualifying period)
Season ticket loan
Free annual eye test
Recruitment referral scheme
Corporate gym membership rates
Give as you earn (a tax-free benefit)
Holiday buy in (after 2 years)
Perks include pay day pizza, fresh fruit, daily breakfast
The Role – Director/Executive Director (Corporate)
This is a fantastic opportunity for someone to develop their own practice area within the already successful corporate team. The structure of the company is that there isn't an MD but a board of Executive Directors (many of who were MD's at a previous company) who all report into the CEO. Whilst we are ideally looking for a Director, more experienced candidates will be considered for an Executive Director role.
We’re looking for someone who has a strong track record in corporate comms (across multiple sectors but ideally with sector experience including manufacturing, resources, energy or tech, or an interest in sustainability/CSR/environmental) loves the challenge of pitching and winning new business and acting as a trusted client lead. An agency track record is essential over in house experience.
A full job spec can be provided but key responsibilities will include:
Growing and developing channel agnostic business across the agency
Overseeing the development and delivery of multi disciplinary communications programmes
Financial management – from budget setting/management/revenue forecasting to ensuring we deliver against the agency’s own profitability targets
Organically growing clients and pitching/converting new business
Deputising for the COO/Team Head in their absence and helping to inspiring and leading the team
In return this role will provide you with excellent career progression, an exciting client portfolio and a competitive salary and benefits package.

Job Title: Director, Business Systems Analysis - London or UK-Based Telecommute
Job Description:
Already Fortune 6, we are totally focused on innovation and change. We work a little harder. We aim a little higher. We expect more from ourselves and each other. And at the end of the day, we're doing a lot of good.

Through our family of businesses and a lot of inspired individuals, we're building a high-performance health care system that works better for more people in more ways than ever. Now we're looking to reinforce our team with people who are decisive, brilliant - and built for speed.
About the role:
As the Business Systems Analyst you will be responsible for creating and delivering high quality system solutions for our applications, products and services across all technology functions. You will use your stakeholder management expertise, work with users, clients and technology specialists to define business processes and systems to support those process. In this function our Business Systems Analyst are expected to support development systems, perform analysis and champion relationships with business liaisons to understand and refine business requirements. With a focus on cost you will also ensure that the systems are cohesive and the highest standards and methods are met consistently across the enterprise.

This is a market facing role, which requires deep NHS experience, including NHS Digital’s technical and data framework, architecture and roadmap. The successful candidate will also be required to support direct customer/market engagement, including NHS senior stakeholders, B2B partners and system partners.
You will be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role, as well as providing development for other roles you may be interested in.
Required Qualifications:
Undergraduate degree or equivalent experience.
Bachelor's degree in Business, Computer Science or relevant field
Significant experience in a Business Analyst role
Deep expertise and experience working with the NHS, with strong knowledge of NHS digital standards, regulations, and business processes that drive business decisions
Ability to work in a collaborative environment, working closely with product managers and solution architecture and technology deliver teams
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills


Careers with Optum. Here's the idea. We built an entire organization around one giant objective; make the health system work better for everyone. So when it comes to how we use the world's large accumulation of health-related information, or guide health and lifestyle choices or manage pharmacy benefits for millions, our first goal is to leap beyond the status quo and uncover new ways to serve. Optum, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, brings together some of the greatest minds and most advanced ideas on where health care has to go in order to reach its fullest potential. For you, that means working on high performance teams against sophisticated challenges that matter. Optum, incredible ideas in one incredible company and a singular opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)
